  • Experience in working with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and Tableau, building interactive reports, complex dashboards.
  • Data mining capabilities with ability to evaluate data and derive actionable insight and make recommendations to continuous improvements.
  • Proficiency in using SQL to query large relational databases and ability to build and maintain processes to extract & integrate data from various sources.
  • Exposure to could-based platforms (Azure, Snowflake, others) and data science tools (R, Python, Apache Spark, others)
  • Ability to collaborate with cross functional teams with ability to work on multiple projects at once, while routinely reprioritizing tasks to manage and meet deadlines in a fast paced work environment.
  • Experience in data mapping and data profiling
  • Business acumen :ability to think from an overall “best for business” perspective.
  • Excellent communication skills and interpersonal/ team effectiveness – ability to communicate to various levels of management.


EDUCATION


  • University/College degree in Data Analytics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field
  • Microsoft certification (preferred): Power BI Data Analyst Associate


Why Join Us

  • Work in an environment where safety is our first priority
  • The opportunity to build a career with a growing company
  • Medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Wellness programs to support your family’s well-being
  • A Retirement Savings Program with a company match
  • Company team wear allowance
  • Employee Appreciation Day
  • Company sponsored social events
  • Community volunteering

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operations™ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing — and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means you’ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team that’s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, you’ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term.

About the role:

We're looking for an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our dynamic People Analytics team. In this role, you will be instrumental in providing crucial analytical support and boosting our team's efficiency. You will become our go-to person for foundational data activities and allowing us to provide even better frontline support to our stakeholders. This is a fantastic opportunity to build a strong foundation in data analysis within a fast-growing, innovative company.

This is a remote position open to candidates based in Canada. Relocation assistance will not be provided for this role.

You should apply if:



You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impact—helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role won’t be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, and countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper-growth environment.
You’re energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-caliber team that will encourage you to do your best.



In this role, you will:



Become a local expert and superuser of our standard dashboards and tables, understanding the data landscape inside and out.
Manage and triage requests coming through various inbound channels, including Slack and Zendesk, ensuring efficient routing and resolution.
Provide timely and accurate responses to data inquiries, using tools such as Tableau and Google Sheets to generate tables and charts where appropriate
Host regular office hours for people and recruiting stakeholders, offering guidance and support in navigating our data resources.
Support the creation of recurring reports and presentations, including data pulls and formatting for recurring slide decks and other consistent needs.
Perform evergreen and consistent data-related activities, ensuring data accuracy and accessibility.
Champion, role model, and embed Samsara’s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices.



Minimum requirements for the role:



Bachelor’s Degree or years of relevant work experience in lieu of degree.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in Data Analytics.
A customer-service-oriented mindset with a genuine desire to help others.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate technical data concepts into clear and understandable language for non-technical audiences.
Solid proficiency in Google Sheets, including the ability to perform calculations, create pivot tables, and develop insightful visualizations.
Experience with Google Slides and a keen eye for robust formatting and presentation.
Familiarity with business intelligence tools for exploring data.
A foundational understanding of basic statistical concepts.



An ideal candidate also has:



Basic Tableau development and exploration experience.
Basic knowledge of SQL for data querying.
Familiarity with Python for data manipulation and analysis.



The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

$73,100—$94,600 CAD

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, and other characteristics protected by law. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems and want to ensure that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Benefits

Full time employees receive a competitive total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at our Benefits site to learn more.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Flexible Working

At Samsara, we embrace a flexible working model that caters to the diverse needs of our teams. Our offices are open for those who prefer to work in-person and we also support remote work where it aligns with our operational requirements. For certain positions, being close to one of our offices or within a specific geographic area is important to facilitate collaboration, access to resources, or alignment with our service regions. In these cases, the job description will clearly indicate any working location requirements. Our goal is to ensure that all members of our team can contribute effectively, whether they are working on-site, in a hybrid model, or fully remotely. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individual’s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company and in the specified work location, if applicable.

Fraudulent Employment Offers

Samsara is aware of scams involving fake job interviews and offers. Please know we do not charge fees to applicants at any stage of the hiring process. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in ‘@samsara.com’ or ‘@us-greenhouse-mail.io’. For more information regarding fraudulent employment offers, please visit our blog post here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:




Jackson Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing information technology team! In this position you’ll perform extensive quantitative and qualitative analysis to support business decision-making across the organization. The creation and use of reports and dashboards delivered through the Microsoft Power BI platform and ancillary tools will be central to providing insights to business partners. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively is critical to the success of this role.




ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




Collaborate frequently with business partners to understand their business processes and identify opportunities to drive better decision-making through data & analytic solutions
Gain familiarity with the data underlying Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow, M365 and other platforms in use across the organization to draw out actionable insights
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis around various business subject matters, and provide data driven and actionable insights through the creation of reports and data visualizations to facilitate business decision making
Design, develop, test, and support both standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards as requested by business partners
Ensure reports, dashboards and data feeds are secured and follow data governance and security policies
Analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques
Develop templates and branding to deliver a consistent and intuitive end-user experience for analytic solutions




QUALIFICATIONS – EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:




3-5 years of experience in an analytical role
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required
Self-motivated with the ability to define, structure, and prioritize work




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:




Expertise in building and deploying reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI
Familiarity with dimensional database models
Proficient with data visualizations and data storytelling to drive insights and decision-making
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication skills
Experience in mapping business processes and recommending changes to better align with analytical needs
Experience with one or more of the following business platforms preferred: Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow
Experience in analytics for Human Resources, Insurance, or Medical Billing a plus

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Passionate about precision medicine and advancing the healthcare industry?

Recent advancements in underlying technology have finally made it possible for AI to impact clinical care in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.

What You’ll Do

Do you find the slow pace of drug development unacceptable? Are you ready to use cutting-edge technology to accelerate the completion of cancer clinical trials? Are you passionate about improving patient access to new treatment options? We are looking for a Tempus Time Analyst, possessing innovative ideas and a desire to put them into action.

What You’ll Do


Work with multiple data sources/systems to extract and summarize relevant information to be used across the broader TIME team
Translate business needs into operational processes and understand the necessary technical and operational requirements.
Create and combine various data sources using SQL and dbt in order to identify patients and derive insights
Consistently evaluate and improve the trial-matching processes including documentation and the organization of documents and templates
Maintain highest quality standard through rigorous QA process to identify and correct mistakes and inconsistencies in data and reporting
Create dashboards using data visualization tools to improve and streamline reporting


Required Knowledge And Skills


Bachelor's degree in an analytical or healthcare related field
1+ years of relevant work experience
SQL Proficiency
Experience with Looker or other data visualization tools
Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work efficiently under time constraints
Proficient in Google Suite (Gmail, Google Docs, Sheets, etc.) and Excel
Experience with Looker or other data visualization tools
Obsessive attention to detail
Ability and willingness to work in an agile and expanding team environment


Nice To Haves


Experience working with EMR and clinical data


Illinois Pay Range: $45,000-$65,000

New York Pay Range: $50,000-$70,000

The expected salary range above is applicable if the role is performed from Illinois and may vary for other locations (California, Colorado, New York). Actual salary may vary based on qualifications and experience. Tempus offers a full range of benefits, which may include incentive compensation, restricted stock units, medical and other benefits depending on the position.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst – Remediation Analytics Team

Client: A leading Swoon partner in the financial services industry

Location: 100% Remote (U.S. based)

Contract Type: W2

Pay Rate: $74/hour

Duration: 6-month contract (potential for extension based on business needs)




Job Description:

We’re partnering with a top-tier client in the financial services industry to hire a Data Analyst for a critical role on their Remediation Analytics Team. This team is responsible for identifying and correcting customer-impacting errors related to credit card products — such as issuing refunds, adjusting interest rates, and correcting credit report inaccuracies with bureaus like Equifax and TransUnion.

As a Data Analyst in this group, you’ll play a key role in calculating accurate refund amounts and supporting the development of remediation strategies. This role is highly collaborative and compliance-driven, requiring interaction with Business Risk, Compliance, and Business Analyst teams. You’ll be expected to handle large data sets, extract insights, automate reporting, and communicate your findings clearly to both technical and business stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to identify discrepancies and calculate customer refunds
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Compliance, Business Risk, Analysts) to understand root causes and determine remediation actions
Support migration efforts from SAS to Python-based solutions
Write and optimize complex SQL queries for data extraction and validation
Automate recurring reporting processes and build dashboards for key performance metrics
Present analytical findings and recommendations to leadership
Ensure accuracy and completeness in all remediation outputs and documentation
Support A/B testing, segmentation analysis, and statistical modeling to refine remediation strategies




Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role (Data Engineers with strong analytical background also welcome)
Strong command of SQL, Python, and SAS
Experience in data validation, cleansing, and remediation logic
Experience working in compliance-heavy environments
Strong communication skills — must be able to explain technical issues to non-technical stakeholders
Highly detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple priorities
Prior experience in financial services is strongly preferred; healthcare or insurance also a plus
Experience with tools such as Tableau, Snowflake, Redshift, or other cloud-based data warehouses is a plus




Interview Process:

3 Rounds (30–45 mins each):
Technical Interview
Team Collaboration & Communication Assessment
Final Technical Deep-Dive / Culture Fit

HTML:
Job Title: Data Analyst – Remediation Analytics Team

Client: A leading Swoon partner in the financial services industry

Location: 100% Remote (U.S. based)

Contract Type: W2

Pay Rate: $74/hour

Duration: 6-month contract (potential for extension based on business needs)


Job Description:

We’re partnering with a top-tier client in the financial services industry to hire a Data Analyst for a critical role on their Remediation Analytics Team. This team is responsible for identifying and correcting customer-impacting errors related to credit card products — such as issuing refunds, adjusting interest rates, and correcting credit report inaccuracies with bureaus like Equifax and TransUnion.

As a Data Analyst in this group, you’ll play a key role in calculating accurate refund amounts and supporting the development of remediation strategies. This role is highly collaborative and compliance-driven, requiring interaction with Business Risk, Compliance, and Business Analyst teams. You’ll be expected to handle large data sets, extract insights, automate reporting, and communicate your findings clearly to both technical and business stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze large datasets to identify discrepancies and calculate customer refunds
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Compliance, Business Risk, Analysts) to understand root causes and determine remediation actions
  • Support migration efforts from SAS to Python-based solutions
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries for data extraction and validation
  • Automate recurring reporting processes and build dashboards for key performance metrics
  • Present analytical findings and recommendations to leadership
  • Ensure accuracy and completeness in all remediation outputs and documentation
  • Support A/B testing, segmentation analysis, and statistical modeling to refine remediation strategies


Required Skills & Experience:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role (Data Engineers with strong analytical background also welcome)
  • Strong command of SQL, Python, and SAS
  • Experience in data validation, cleansing, and remediation logic
  • Experience working in compliance-heavy environments
  • Strong communication skills — must be able to explain technical issues to non-technical stakeholders
  • Highly detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple priorities
  • Prior experience in financial services is strongly preferred; healthcare or insurance also a plus
  • Experience with tools such as Tableau, Snowflake, Redshift, or other cloud-based data warehouses is a plus


Interview Process:

  • 3 Rounds (30–45 mins each):
  1. Technical Interview
  2. Team Collaboration & Communication Assessment
  3. Final Technical Deep-Dive / Culture Fit

Title: Velocity - Data Analyst Internship/Co-Op - Fall 2025
Description:
Requisition ID: 224423

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Velocity - Data Analyst Internship/Co-op - Fall 2025

Term: September 2025 – December 2025

Work Hours/Week: 37.5

Application Deadline: 5/23/25

Ready to Start your Journey with Scotiabank? Apply Now!

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are eager to learn about you, your interests, and your potential.

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Be involved in the definition of business requirements and processes, ensuring that progress can be measured against planned objectives by working with different teams, and internal partners; performing analysis and completing reports to measure project success and impact to business
Prepare reports and dashboards to inform strategic decision-making including trending analysis, projections and forecasts utilizing statistical modelling
Investigate and become an expert in available data sources of data, transform and determine how they can be interpreted for analysis
Flex your analytical skills by identifying and analyzing business and technical requirements to create diagrams, flow charts, and documentation
Make impact by constantly identifying and implementing process improvements
Experiment & learn!


Requirements

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:


You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.
You have strong written/verbal communication and project management skills.
You have knowledge/experience in:
Managing process and planning, facilitating teamwork, and coordinating the execution of multiple deliverables.
Interpreting and consolidating large amounts of information in actionable recommendations.
Using sound judgment in the creation of analysis, validation, interpretation, and presentation of findings.
Cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., Enterprise Data Warehouse, Unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, SAS, CSV)
Visualization tools like PowerBI, Tableau or Olikview
Data Analysis/manipulation tools for working with data (e.g., SQL, DB2, MySQL, Python, R)
Making sense of data, creating reports, and communicating KPI’s to those who don’t speak technology


What’s in it for you?


You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.


Please Follow The Steps Below To Successfully Apply

Step 1: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

Step 2: Complete a short one-way video interview here.

Step 3: Complete a coding test through Codility to showcase your technical skills by solving job-related problems. Please make sure to have this Codility test completed prior to applying through our career site. When you're ready, click here to begin the assessment.

Step 4: Once you have completed your Plum Profile, one-way video interview and Codility test, apply to the role on our website. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

Note: The one-way video interview & codility assessment for all our Velocity Technology Fall 2025 Internship applications are the same. You only need to complete this one!


To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TD Thornton is a premier consulting firm specializing in project management and project controls solutions. Our strong onboarding and training program sets our people up for success. All are welcome to apply, especially those with engineering, construction management, business analytics, scheduling, and project management backgrounds and anyone who truly enjoys teamwork.

Job Overview
Sector: Electric Utilities,

Seniority: Mid-Level

Location: San Ramon, Bay Area, Hybrid

As a Data & Reporting Analyst for the IT department, you will support our electric utility client by developing meaningful data insights and delivering robust reporting solutions that inform strategic decisions. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you’ll gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets, transforming them into dynamic dashboards and reports in Excel and Power BI. You’ll proactively address reporting needs, engage with stakeholders, and play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions within the IT function. Additionally, you will guide junior consultants and manage small-scale projects, ensuring alignment with client specifications and standards.

Your Day-to-Day Activities:



Work with various stakeholders to understand business processes and discover reporting needs for the client
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, develop data models, design dashboards, and reports
Analyze complex data sets from multiple sources based on the business requirements
Gather, clean, analyze, and summarize data related to the Line of Business assigned
Build dynamic dashboards in Excel and Power BI depending on the clients’ needs
Present data/ report findings to managers and directors to aid in making business decisions
Proactively follows up on issues and initiatives for senior leaders to ensure successful resolution and implementation
Train and mentor entry to mid-level consultants
Manage projects from start to finish with minimum direction and supervision
Create and/or migrate existing reports to Power BI
Effectively plans and executes work on a small project; integrates all aspects, tracks, and ensures that work progresses are on schedule and meets the client’s specifications or required standards
Facilitates problem-solving sessions and workshops with a diverse set of business team members





You’ll be prepared for this job if you have…



Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of budget management, including forecasting and tracking actual expenses against projected budgets, ensuring financial targets are met
5 – 10 years of experience in Data Analytics
3+ years of building visualizations in Power BI
5+ years of experience with Excel





You’ll stand out if you have…



10+ years of Data Analytics experience
5+ years of Power BI experience
Problem-solving and Communication skills





Compensation & Benefits


A Competitive Base Salary
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
Health Savings Accounts (HSA's)
401(k) with a Company Match
Annual Bonus
Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible Spending Account





About TD Thornton
Since 2005, TD Thornton has been helping our clients bridge organizational gaps by providing best-in-class consulting services and staff augmentation. Whether we are part of the contractor’s team or serving as an owner’s representative, we offer a wide spectrum of construction management support services to help our clients mitigate risks and deliver successful project outcomes. We believe our diversity is part of our strength and are proud to be a woman–owned and minority-owned company.

Learn more about us at www.tdthornton.com and on LinkedIn.

By providing your mobile number and opting in via our registration form, you consent to receive text messages (SMS) from TD Thornton.

Terms Of Service - TD Thornton

Privacy Policy - TD Thornton

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Tavily is a search engine specifically designed for AI agents and tailored for real-time online information retrieval. Through the Tavily Search API, AI developers can integrate their applications seamlessly, enhancing the accuracy and reliability of AI-generated content by providing factual and trusted information.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Analyst located in the New York City Metropolitan Area. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, developing and implementing data models, interpreting statistical data, and providing actionable insights. Day-to-day tasks include collecting and interpreting complex data sets, creating dashboards and visualizations, reporting findings to the team, and collaborating with different departments to support data-driven decision-making processes.




Qualifications

Strong Analytical Skills and proficiency in Data Analytics
Experience with Statistics and Data Modeling
Excellent Communication skills, both written and verbal
Proficiency in data visualization tools and software
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience in the AI or technology industry is a plus

Title: Analyst, Analytics and Forecasting
Description:
About the Team:

You will be a part of the Network Operations Excellence (NOE) team which is a component of the Global Support and Integrity Operations (GSIO) organization. The primary role of this organization is to provide the best support for Dashers, Consumers and Merchants to maximize Customer retention while minimizing cost. We achieve this by creating feedback mechanisms and insights to influence process design and resource allocation to improve the experience. Our ultimate objective is to enhance the experience of all customers engaging with DoorDash, and improve key performance indicators (KPIs). To achieve this objective, the team will operate and execute support experiences.

About the Role:

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analyst to join our Forecasting and Network Operations Excellence team. In this role, you'll support the team by collecting, analyzing, and reporting data that helps scale our global operations and improve our service delivery. This is an ideal opportunity for someone early in their analytics career who is eager to learn, grow, and make an impact in a fast-paced environment.

You'll work closely with Senior Analysts and cross-functional teams such as Workforce Management, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Operations, Finance and Customer Experience. to assist in reporting, process improvement, and the development of data-driven insights. Strong attention to detail, eagerness to learn new tools, and comfort with working in a data-rich environment are key to success

You're excited about this opportunity because you will:


Support the team in gathering, cleaning, and analyzing data to inform business decisions
Work on creating and maintaining dashboards and recurring reports using tools like Excel and BI platforms (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Sigma)
Work with stakeholders to understand business questions and help provide data-driven answers
Participate in the demand planning process by supporting data collection and model updates
Help identify small-scale opportunities for automation and workflow improvements
Monitor and triage incoming requests in our team channel, assisting with ad-hoc problem-solving to help unlock operational efficiencies
Collaborate with peers and more senior team members to learn best practices in forecasting and analytics


We're excited about you because you:


Have a foundational understanding of SQL and Excel; you're comfortable learning new tools and techniques
Are curious and eager to develop your technical and analytical skills
Enjoy solving problems and working with data to uncover insights
Are detail-oriented, organized, and capable of managing multiple tasks
Communicate clearly and effectively, and enjoy collaborating with team members
Are excited to grow your career in a data-focused role within a fast-paced tech environment


About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees' happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in certain locations.

The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

To request a reasonable accommodation under applicable law or alternate selection process, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

Title: Data Analyst - $125k+
Description:
Feldspar & Flint is a NYC metro-based Recruiting firm dedicated to identifying and providing exceptional candidates to meet the specific needs of our clients.




Our client is looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to design and maintain BI solutions, perform data analysis, and optimize systems. Candidates should have 3+ years of BI development experience, proficiency in SQL and BI tools, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders to meet data needs.




Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions, including data warehouses, dashboards, and reporting tools.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into BI systems.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decision-making.
Optimize and enhance existing BI systems for improved performance and scalability.
Develop and implement data models, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Create and maintain documentation for BI solutions and processes.
Provide training and support to end-users on BI tools and systems.
Stay updated with the latest BI technologies and best practices.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in BI development and data analysis.
Proficiency in SQL and database management.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.

Skills:

Advanced proficiency in SQL and BI tools.
Strong data modeling and ETL skills.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
Show more

Feldspar & Flint is a NYC metro-based Recruiting firm dedicated to identifying and providing exceptional candidates to meet the specific needs of our clients.


Our client is looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to design and maintain BI solutions, perform data analysis, and optimize systems. Candidates should have 3+ years of BI development experience, proficiency in SQL and BI tools, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders to meet data needs.


Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions, including data warehouses, dashboards, and reporting tools.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
  • Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into BI systems.
  • Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decision-making.
  • Optimize and enhance existing BI systems for improved performance and scalability.
  • Develop and implement data models, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Create and maintain documentation for BI solutions and processes.
  • Provide training and support to end-users on BI tools and systems.
  • Stay updated with the latest BI technologies and best practices.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in BI development and data analysis.
  • Proficiency in SQL and database management.
  • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus.

Skills:

  • Advanced proficiency in SQL and BI tools.
  • Strong data modeling and ETL skills.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Effective communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are offering an exciting opportunity for a detail-oriented and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in our New York City office. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

With over 138 years of experience, H&H is a trusted full-service infrastructure engineering firm. Our clients, including infrastructure owners, contractors, and colleagues, rely on us for intricate and innovative engineering solutions. They trust our time-tested ability to manage the entire life cycle of a project, from the study and planning phase through to design and construction. With over 600 talented employees located across 30 offices nationwide, H&H can efficiently and effectively handle assignments of all sizes, types, and delivery methods around the country and across the globe.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis and Reporting:


Collect, process, and analyze large datasets from sources such as project management software, financial systems, and CRM/ERP tools
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to enhance business performance insights
Create process flows and automate analytics
Build API interfaces between operational and analytics platforms
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, and communicate findings to management



Data Management:


Develop data marts and associative data models
Conduct data forensics to resolve data governance issues
Participate in data governance activities



BI Tools and Systems:


Utilize BI tools (e.g., QLIK, Talend, Power BI, Tableau, SQL) to create and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through data governance and regular audits
Stay updated on the latest BI tools and technologies to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities



Collaboration with Teams:


Collaborate with engineering and finance teams to understand data needs and deliver insights for project planning and optimization
Align BI efforts with strategic goals by working with finance, operations, and management teams
Provide training and support for end-users on BI tools and reporting processes



Strategic Planning and Decision Support:


Provide data-driven insights and recommendations in strategic planning sessions
Analyze market trends, client data, and project performance metrics to support business development
Develop KPIs and metrics to monitor and enhance business performance



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
Master's degree (preferred)
Minimum of three to five years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a similar role (engineering consulting or related industry)
Experience with BI tools (e.g.,QLIK, Talend, Power BI, Tableau, SQL) and data modeling techniques
Proficient in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Relevant certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate) (preferred)



Preferred Attributes


Understanding engineering project management methodologies and tools
Experience working in a consulting environment with exposure to various industries
Proactive, self-motivated, and detail oriented



Benefits

Salary Range- $80,000-$100,000 annually. Salary commensurate with experience.

We offer a professional work environment, competitive salary, benefits package and 401(k).

EOE M/F/ DISABILITY/VETS

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
OpSheet is the efficiency platform for Walt Disney Experiences and is the system of record for operating hours, attraction wait times and Guests carried, and more. The Business Intelligence Analyst is a critical member of the OpSheet team focused on the day-to-day application, administration, user support, and troubleshooting of OpSheet’s reporting ecosystem. In this role, you will partner with clients and other teams to develop meaningful and impactful reporting solutions to meet the needs of all levels of Operations, and work with domestic and international partners to drive consistency in reporting functionality and development. You will document and communicate processes and report functionality to end users as the Subject Matter Expert in the development of reports and training materials, and you will manage the OpSheet reporting space and keep up with technological and system changes as they occur.

We are seeking an enthusiastic Cast Member who can be self-directed and capable of positive interactions with a variety of Cast Members in various departments and levels of authority including Industrial Engineering, Operations, and Technology. The ideal candidate is highly analytical, resourceful, intellectually curious, team oriented, and will have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You’re a steadfast problem solver, delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment. The ideal candidate makes data-driven decisions, obsesses about the user experience, forms strong yet loosely held opinions, and can build trust with all areas of the business.

Up to two weeks a month will spent in an on-call 24/7 role. They will assist in trouble-shooting users at any site experiencing issues with the system, interfaces, or reporting that couldn’t be solved locally. Have knowledge of how each site/interface uses the OpSheet system to be able to analyze the impact of a system outage on a particular site. This may involve engaging the appropriate partners, and distributing communication as needed for any issue that may arise.

Basic Qualifications:



Proficiency in Business Objects reporting
Proficiency in acquiring, organizing, cleansing, manipulating, and mining large amounts of data
Strong partnering skills
You are a demonstrated self-starter, and you provide strong strategic aptitude, clear thinking and communicating, and great decision making.
You obsess about making our end-users happy and have strong opinions about good customer experience.
You bring a strong attention to detail, with an ability to take a step back and understand the bigger picture.
You have excellent written and oral communication skills.
You are scrappy and resourceful, with no fear of getting your hands dirty and an impulse to be the first to tackle any challenge.
Proven ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment as part of a high-performance development team.
Ability to be flexible with work schedule, including weekends and holidays. Up to 2 weeks a month spent as the on-call point of contact for troubleshooting.



Preferred Qualifications:



Proven knowledge of Theme Park Operations or the OpSheet Platform
Proficiency in Business Objects semantic layer (universe) design
Proficiency in Tableau or other visualization/reporting software
Proficiency in Python



Our Benefits:

Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

#DXMedia

The hiring range for this position in California is $94,200.00 - $126,200.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We are partnering with one of our staffing partners who is searching for a Business data analyst for a Healthcare client. Responsibility to manage and analyze data while also building the infrastructure needed for efficient data processing. This hybrid role is ideal for candidates who have experience in both data engineering and analytics, enabling them to work across multiple data functions. You will collect, process, and analyze data to drive business insights while optimizing data workflows and pipelines




Salary $50k-75k slight flexibility for a good candidate. Due to low rates only direct applicants no c2c candidates please




Responsibilities:

·Design and develop ETL pipelines for data ingestion and transformation.

Analyze large datasets and generate actionable insights to support decision-making.
Build and maintain data warehouses and reporting solutions.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance across platforms.
Develop dashboards and reports using BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to optimize data strategy and architecture.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and data pipelines.
Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop).
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage complex datasets.
Experience with Python, Scala, or R for data analytics and engineering.
Exposure to Kafka, Airflow, or similar data orchestration tools.
Familiarity with machine learning or predictive analytics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Objetivo principal:

El candidato ideal será capaz de interpretar y analizar datos complejos para ayudar a la empresa a tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Este individuo también deberá tener un fuerte sentido de la iniciativa, capacidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva y un profundo entendimiento del negocio y el producto.




¿Qué harás?

Realizar análisis de datos complejos e interpretar resultados.
Utilizar plataformas de nube para almacenamiento y análisis de datos.
Crear y optimizar modelos matemáticos para mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Dominar las bibliotecas de R y Python para el análisis de datos.
Comunicar resultados de análisis de datos de manera efectiva, a través de narrativas claras y concisas (storytelling).
Presentar hallazgos y entender las necesidades del negocio y el producto.
Uso de herramientas ETL, preferentemente Dataiku.




¿A quién buscamos?

Experiencia de 3 a 4 años en roles similares.
Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o afin.
Experiencia en análisis de datos y modelado matemático.
Dominio de las bibliotecas de R y Python.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ETL, preferentemente Dataiku.
Inglés intermedio.
Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y de forma independiente.
Comprensión profunda del negocio y el producto.
Experiencia en la utilización de software de visualización de datos como Tableau o Power BI sería una ventaja.
Habilidades en comunicación, trabajo en equipo, negociación, organización, solución de problemas.




“En Walmart de México y Centroamérica estamos comprometidos con una cultura de Pertenencia, por lo que buscamos incorporar el mejor talento basándonos en competencias, habilidades y potencial; no discriminamos por ningún motivo, incluyendo género, edad, origen étnico, apariencia física, estado civil, estado de salud, situación socioeconómica, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género por ello durante el proceso de atracción y selección no solicitaremos información personal, fotografías o análisis clínicos de ningún tipo. Consideramos que los datos personales del candidato o candidata no son relevantes durante el proceso de entrevista ni para la selección final. En Walmart de México y Centroamérica nos comprometemos con nuestros asociados que encuentren día a día en el trabajo un ambiente de respeto, dónde es libre de discriminación y acoso sexual.”

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Terrabis is a leading privately held cannabis company with a bold growth strategy. Operating in both wholesale and retail, we’re at the forefront of the industry, setting new standards, and pushing boundaries. Join us in shaping the future of cannabis.

Position Summary

Terrabis is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to drive insights, with a strong emphasis on business, customer and marketing analytics. This role will build and maintain dashboards to monitor business performance, customer behavior, marketing performance, and operational KPIs, while enabling stakeholders to make data-driven decisions. Additionally, this role will ensure data integrity through data pipeline monitoring and data enrichment through enhancing quality, value, and usability of data.

Responsibilities

Customer and Marketing Analytics


Partner with the marketing team to deliver customer data insights that enable deeper personalization across CRM, website, and other marketing channels.
Support the development and execution of test plans, campaign strategies, and post-campaign analyses to measure marketing effectiveness and drive continuous optimization.


Reporting and Dashboard Development


Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards to support business functions including Purchasing, Marketing, Retail Operations, and Accounting.
Enable business teams to track and monitor KPIs effectively by delivering accurate and timely reporting solutions.
Drive the adoption of self-service analytics by developing intuitive data visualization tools and empowering teams to generate their own insights.


Ad Hoc Analysis and Insights


Execute ad hoc analysis requests from cross-functional stakeholders and translate data findings into actionable business insights.
Support experimental design and analysis, including A/B tests, to validate strategies and inform decision-making.


Training and Enablement


Deliver training sessions and one-on-one coaching to internal stakeholders on analytics tools, dashboard usage, and data interpretation best practices.
Create clear documentation of data processes, reporting frameworks, and best practices to promote knowledge-sharing and organizational learning.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
2+ years of experience in working in data analytics or business intelligence including customer and marketing analytics.
Proficiency in writing SQL, Python, and other programming languages.
Experience in managing and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines and data integrations.
Proficiency in visualization tools such as Power BI and developing analytics dashboards.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Experience in a regulated industry, and Ecommerce (B2C) preferred.


Additional Information

Terrabis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

Data Analyst Pay Range: $90,000 USD - $100,000 USD

Title: BI / Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce's client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced BI/Data Analyst to join their team in Cornelius, NC. In this role, the BI/Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining insightful dashboards and reports using Domo, conducting in-depth data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making across the organization. Candidates must travel to Greater Charlotte 2 or 3 times a month. Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations in Domo to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide business insights
Optimize Domo dashboards for performance, usability, and data accuracy
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and translate them into effective Domo solutions
Implement best practices for data visualization and dashboard design within the Domo environment
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement across various business areas
Prepare and present reports, presentations, and data visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and maintain regular reporting processes to monitor business performance and track progress against goals
Write complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and load data from various sources, including our Snowflake data warehouse
Optimize SQL queries for performance and efficiency
Develop and maintain data models within Snowflake to support reporting and analysis needs
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation and cleansing procedures
Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability
Contribute to the development and implementation of data governance policies and procedures
Maintain documentation of data sources, data models, and reporting processes


Requirements


Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - or equivalent experience
Proven experience as a Data or Business Intelligence Manager or Architect or similar role, with expertise in managing data platforms such as Snowflake
Strong proficiency in data visualization tools like Domo with experience in creating dashboards and reports
Experience in designing and implementing data warehouses, data lakes, and ETL processes
Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages for data manipulation and automation
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into data solutions
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. HTML:
Responsibilities

Kforce's client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced BI/Data Analyst to join their team in Cornelius, NC. In this role, the BI/Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining insightful dashboards and reports using Domo, conducting in-depth data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making across the organization. Candidates must travel to Greater Charlotte 2 or 3 times a month. Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations in Domo to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide business insights
  • Optimize Domo dashboards for performance, usability, and data accuracy
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather reporting requirements and translate them into effective Domo solutions
  • Implement best practices for data visualization and dashboard design within the Domo environment
  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement across various business areas
  • Prepare and present reports, presentations, and data visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Develop and maintain regular reporting processes to monitor business performance and track progress against goals
  • Write complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and load data from various sources, including our Snowflake data warehouse
  • Optimize SQL queries for performance and efficiency
  • Develop and maintain data models within Snowflake to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation and cleansing procedures
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of data governance policies and procedures
  • Maintain documentation of data sources, data models, and reporting processes

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - or equivalent experience
  • Proven experience as a Data or Business Intelligence Manager or Architect or similar role, with expertise in managing data platforms such as Snowflake
  • Strong proficiency in data visualization tools like Domo with experience in creating dashboards and reports
  • Experience in designing and implementing data warehouses, data lakes, and ETL processes
  • Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages for data manipulation and automation
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into data solutions
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Fanduel

FanDuel Group is the premier mobile gaming company in the United States and Canada. FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across mobile wagering including: America’s #1 Sportsbook, FanDuel Sportsbook; its leading iGaming platform, FanDuel Casino; the industry’s unquestioned leader in horse racing and advance-deposit wagering, FanDuel Racing; and its daily fantasy sports product.

In addition, FanDuel Group operates FanDuel TV, its broadly distributed linear cable television network and FanDuel TV+, its leading direct-to-consumer OTT platform. FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states, Canada, and Puerto Rico.

The company is based in New York with US offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta, and Jersey City, as well as global offices in Canada and Scotland. The company’s affiliates have offices worldwide, including in Ireland, Portugal, Romania, and Australia.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

FanDuel is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in growing the experimentation function within the Sportsbook Commercial team. You will help to accelerate the scalability and sophistication of best-in-class experimentation practice while maintaining standardization of processes across teams. The Senior Analyst will partner with several commercial stakeholders and will be responsible for designing and analyzing experiments that help to answer key business questions. This person will have the opportunity to be a part of designing technical solutions that support FanDuel’s ability to test and learn at scale, driving a strong culture of data informed decision making.

In addition to the specific responsibilities outlined above, employees may be required to perform other such duties as assigned by the Company. This ensures operational flexibility and allows the Company to meet evolving business needs.

THE GAME PLAN

Everyone on our team has a part to play


Own end-to-end delivery of experiments (e.g., A/B/n, multivariate, multi-armed bandit), including design, execution and analysis, ensuring best practices and statistical rigor are met across all stages.
Be a key partner to Sportsbook Commercial teams in advancing our understanding generosity and customer value proposition. Work closely with analytical teams to gather insights and develop testable hypotheses driven by these insights.
Provide thought leadership in experimentation capabilities development. Partner with teams across the organization (Product, Data Science, MLE, etc.) to implement scalable, modular solutions.
Mentor junior analysts to help build their technical skills, such as statistical analysis, coding best practices.
Drive FanDuel’s test-and-learn mindset across teams by promoting the value of experimentation, sharing results transparently, and encouraging iterative improvement.



THE STATS

What we're looking for in our next teammate


3+ years of experience in data focused role such as data science, analytics or research.
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or similar domain.
Experience designing and running A/B/n experiments in a fast-paced environment. Familiarity with advanced testing techniques (multi-armed bandit, synthetic controls) a plus.
Advanced experience with SQL, Python and/or object-oriented programming. Experience with Databricks, including packaging code and app deployment a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills, with ability to work through ambiguity and deliver solutions to business problems.
Commercial acumen: understanding of P&L, business principles and commercial levers
A “can-do” attitude and the type of person who constantly looks for solutions and better ways of operating
Knowledge of sports and/or experience working within a heavily regulated industry is a plus
Don’t check all the boxes? That’s okay! We encourage you to still apply if you feel like you possess an adjacent skill set and are interested in learning more about this position.



Player Benefits

We treat our team right

We offer amazing benefits above and beyond the basics. We have an array of health plans to choose from (some as low as $0 per paycheck) that include programs for fertility and family planning, mental health support, and fitness benefits. We offer generous paid time off (PTO & sick leave), annual bonus and long-term incentive opportunities (based on performance), 401k with up to a 5% match, commuter benefits, pet insurance, and more - check out all our benefits here: FanDuel Total Rewards. *Benefits differ across location, role, and level.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principles states, “We are One Team!”. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.

The applicable salary range for this position is $94,000 - $117,500 USD, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support our growing Human Resources department. This is a high-visibility role that serves as a strategic partner to HR leadership, delivering data-driven insights that directly influence decision-making across workforce planning, talent management, and organizational development.




Location: Norristown, PA

Work Setting: Onsite




Responsibilities

Maintain and enhance data integrity across HR platforms, including HRIS, performance systems, and employee surveys
Develop and manage HR data repositories and reporting frameworks to support executive-level decision-making
Partner with HR and IT stakeholders to ensure compliance with data privacy, security, and governance standards
Design and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to track KPIs such as turnover, headcount, compensation, and diversity metrics
Develop scalable visual analytics to support self-service reporting across HR and business functions
Train internal users on best practices in HR data visualization and report usage
Perform trend and root cause analyses to inform strategies around retention, performance, and workforce planning
Leverage predictive analytics to proactively address risks and opportunities in human capital management
Stay current with advancements in HR analytics tools and techniques, including Microsoft Fabric and emerging data technologies
Identify and recommend process enhancements using data insights to improve HR service delivery and program effectiveness
Support automation and operational efficiency initiatives through scripting, querying, and data mapping
Advise on optimization strategies for compensation, benefits, engagement, and staffing models
Serve as a key resource for system maintenance, configuration, and upgrades within the HRIS (Dayforce preferred)
Troubleshoot system issues and document reporting enhancements in collaboration with technical teams
Contribute to the development of best practices for data extraction, integration, and reporting
Additional duties may be assigned to support departmental and organizational priorities.




Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Data Analytics, Business Administration, or related field
2–4 years of relevant experience in HR analytics, workforce reporting, or HRIS management
Master’s degree or HR certifications (SHRM-CP, PHR) preferred but not required

Technical Proficiency

HRIS expertise with demonstrated experience in data extraction and analysis
Advanced knowledge of Power BI and other business intelligence tools
Proficient in SQL, Python, or R for scripting, automation, and statistical analysis
Experience designing queries and scripts across multiple HR or enterprise systems

Core Competencies

Strong analytical, critical thinking, and data storytelling skills
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with HR metrics, KPIs, and compliance frameworks (e.g., EEO, OFCCP, GDPR)
Excellent collaboration skills with the ability to work cross-functionally
