Title: Alternance DATA Analyst D&I (H/F)
Description:
Alternance DATA Analyst D&I (H/F)




Description du poste

Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’analyse des performances, dynamique et prêt(e) à relever de nouveaux défis ? Vous recherchez un stage à impact et porteur de sens ? Le Retail et La Mode vous intéressent, ou vous attirent ! Cette opportunité est faite pour vous !




Où: 22 Rue Bergère 75009 Paris

Département : Ressources Humaines DATA – Diversité & Inclusion







Au sein du département RH - Diversité & Inclusion, en lien étroit avec l’équipe Data Analyse, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la mesure, l’analyse et le pilotage de nos actions en matière de D&I. Vous contribuerez activement aux projets en cours et au développement de nouvelles initiatives au sein de la filiale française.







Vos missions :

Collecter, structurer et analyser les données RH en lien avec la diversité - égalité professionnelle et dans le respect de la réglementation.
Produire des tableaux de bord et indicateurs pour suivre l’évolution de nos engagements D&I.
Concevoir et optimiser des outils d’aide à l’analyse sous Excel et Power BI, tout en réalisant des extractions de données à destination des différents départements.
Contribuer à l’identification des freins systémiques et des leviers d’action pour favoriser l’équité dans les processus RH (recrutement, promotion, rémunération, etc.).
Assurer la mise à jour des outils et garantir la fiabilité des données utilisées.
Effectuer une veille active sur les tendances en data visualisation et partager ces insights avec l’équipe Data pour optimiser nos analyses.







Profil recherché :

vous préparez un Master 2 en Data Science / Business Intelligence
Rigoureux(se) et organisé(e), vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et êtes capable de collaborer efficacement dans un environnement en constante évolution.
Vous maîtrisez Excel et possédez des connaissances sur Power BI.
Vous faites preuve d'une aisance tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit, et êtes capable de communiquer vos analyses et recommandations avec clarté et efficacité.
Curieux(se) et force de proposition, vous aimez prendre des initiatives et contribuer à l’amélioration continue des outils et méthodologies.







En tant qu’employeur, Zara offre à tous ses candidats les mêmes opportunités d’accès à l’emploi sans distinction de genre, d’ethnicité, de religion, d’orientation sexuelle, de statut social, de handicap et d’âge. Zara développe un environnement de travail inclusif qui reflète la diversité de ses clients dans ses équipes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




• Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

• Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

• Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

• Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

• Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

• Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

• Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

• Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

• Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

• Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

• Possibility of Working from Home – we care about results not locations;

• Training Budget for each employee – we care about the growth of our people;

• Private Health Insurance – we care about health on and off working hours;

• 3 Additional Vacation Days – we care about free time;

• Cooking, sports or book club – we care about spending time with our folks;

• Fresh fruits – we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

• Fresh coffee, tea or water – we care about boosting your day.

• A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***Relocation opportunity to Germany***




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (Hybrid – 3 days a week)




We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join my client's dynamic Product team. In this role, you’ll analyze user behavior to generate insights, support A/B testing, and deliver actionable data to drive product enhancements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze user behavior to generate actionable product insights
Support A/B testing from setup to analysis
Monitor data to identify trends, anomalies, and test outcomes
Deliver datasets to support data-driven features
Work on core product areas: search, homepage, filters, and map experience
Contribute to projects exploring AI tools, including AI-powered search features
Focused on improving product and user experience




Essential Skills:

Strong attitude and willingness to learn
Experience with R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, BigQuery
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience with A/B testing
Exposure to consumer-facing apps
Comfortable working with B2B tech products
At least 2 years of Data Analyst experience (open to more experience)




Benefits:

Personalized coaching, free online learning courses, and access to a fully equipped campus library
Relocation and visa support for Germany
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours
Daily canteen lunch, free drinks, and snacks
Health insurance, pension plan
Free on-campus gym and much more!




If you are interested and fit the bill, please apply today as we are scheduling interviews immediately.

Title: Business Data Analyst (FTC)
Description:
Uniphar - Who We Are

With 3,000+ employees across Ireland, the UK, Europe, MENA, and the U.S., Uniphar partners with 200+ top pharmaco-medical manufacturers, delivering specialised, tech-enabled solutions through its three divisions: Medtech, Supply Chain & Retail, and Pharma.

This opportunity sits within Uniphar Medtech, a dedicated division focused on delivering innovative medical technologies and solutions.

Purpose of the Role

Business Data Analyst, Uniphar Medtech.

Please note this is a fixed term contract role for 11 months.

Uniphar Medtech recognise data as a key business asset.

The data analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, interpreting and communicating actionable data insights (anomalies, trends, patterns) to commercial and operations teams through reports, visualisations and presentations. The insights will inform and drive business improvement efforts.

The business data analyst will use data extraction, analysis and presentation tools such as Python, Jet Reporting, Jet Analytics, Power BI and AI to deliver on the above responsibilities.

The data analyst will support many business units (BUs) across Medtech.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

This job description is not an exhaustive list but provides an indication of the main duties and responsibilities of the position.


Collaborate with requestors to design, develop and implement data reports and visualizations to communicate data insights to commercial and operations teams with drill down capability by BU (turn raw data into information)
Develop and maintain data reports and visualisations (to include dashboards) to enable self-service by end users (in time)
Generate, monitor and analyse key process and performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for business improvement
Collaborate with end users to identify key business questions to help provide actionable insights to support business decision making
Stay up to date with the latest data extraction, analysis (to include AI) and visualization techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights
Support ERP project team with the migration of key reports, metrics and dashboards onto the new ERP system that is planned.
Use of SQL, Python or equivalent to extract, clean and analyse datasets from various data sources



Role Requirements

Essential:


Hold a valid working permit (if applicable)
Full Clean Driving license
Good oral and written communications skills
Good numerical skills
General computer skills
Good organisational skills
Good understanding of health and safety issues
Team player be able to interact with all staff at all levels
Good attention to detail
Good process development and problem-solving skills



Desirable:


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data analysis, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
Strong data extraction SQL, Python or other extraction tool skills, with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, preferably Power BI
Experience with reporting/analysis tools such as Jet Reporting/Jet Analytics
2-3 years of experience in a data analysis role with demonstrated business improvements from data insights communicated
Strong analytical skills with a passion for solving complex problems with data insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes


Please note we cannot assist with any visa sponsorship and candidates must have the correct visa to live and work in Ireland.

Why work with us

Our core values, titled our Medtech Mindset, guides our culture and work environment:


We Go Forward Together: We operate as a unified team, leveraging diverse specialties to make swift, collaborative decisions and embrace progress over perfection
We Take Our Business Seriously: We prioritise compliance and risk management to ensure the best outcomes for our patients and partners, supported by our innovative portfolio and commitment to sustainability
We Deliver Exceptional Results: We focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and commercial success to achieve outstanding results for our patients, customers, and business


If you have similar values and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team and help us drive forward together.
Show more
HTML:
Uniphar - Who We Are

With 3,000+ employees across Ireland, the UK, Europe, MENA, and the U.S., Uniphar partners with 200+ top pharmaco-medical manufacturers, delivering specialised, tech-enabled solutions through its three divisions: Medtech, Supply Chain & Retail, and Pharma.

This opportunity sits within Uniphar Medtech, a dedicated division focused on delivering innovative medical technologies and solutions.

Purpose of the Role

Business Data Analyst, Uniphar Medtech.

Please note this is a fixed term contract role for 11 months.

Uniphar Medtech recognise data as a key business asset.

The data analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, interpreting and communicating actionable data insights (anomalies, trends, patterns) to commercial and operations teams through reports, visualisations and presentations. The insights will inform and drive business improvement efforts.

The business data analyst will use data extraction, analysis and presentation tools such as Python, Jet Reporting, Jet Analytics, Power BI and AI to deliver on the above responsibilities.

The data analyst will support many business units (BUs) across Medtech.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

This job description is not an exhaustive list but provides an indication of the main duties and responsibilities of the position.

  • Collaborate with requestors to design, develop and implement data reports and visualizations to communicate data insights to commercial and operations teams with drill down capability by BU (turn raw data into information)
  • Develop and maintain data reports and visualisations (to include dashboards) to enable self-service by end users (in time)
  • Generate, monitor and analyse key process and performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for business improvement
  • Collaborate with end users to identify key business questions to help provide actionable insights to support business decision making
  • Stay up to date with the latest data extraction, analysis (to include AI) and visualization techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights
  • Support ERP project team with the migration of key reports, metrics and dashboards onto the new ERP system that is planned.
  • Use of SQL, Python or equivalent to extract, clean and analyse datasets from various data sources


Role Requirements

Essential:

  • Hold a valid working permit (if applicable)
  • Full Clean Driving license
  • Good oral and written communications skills
  • Good numerical skills
  • General computer skills
  • Good organisational skills
  • Good understanding of health and safety issues
  • Team player be able to interact with all staff at all levels
  • Good attention to detail
  • Good process development and problem-solving skills


Desirable:

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data analysis, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
  • Strong data extraction SQL, Python or other extraction tool skills, with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, preferably Power BI
  • Experience with reporting/analysis tools such as Jet Reporting/Jet Analytics
  • 2-3 years of experience in a data analysis role with demonstrated business improvements from data insights communicated
  • Strong analytical skills with a passion for solving complex problems with data insights
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
  • A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes

Please note we cannot assist with any visa sponsorship and candidates must have the correct visa to live and work in Ireland.

Why work with us

Our core values, titled our Medtech Mindset, guides our culture and work environment:

  • We Go Forward Together: We operate as a unified team, leveraging diverse specialties to make swift, collaborative decisions and embrace progress over perfection
  • We Take Our Business Seriously: We prioritise compliance and risk management to ensure the best outcomes for our patients and partners, supported by our innovative portfolio and commitment to sustainability
  • We Deliver Exceptional Results: We focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and commercial success to achieve outstanding results for our patients, customers, and business

If you have similar values and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team and help us drive forward together.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hey! We're Plum, your smart saving and investing app on a mission to help grow money for life. Whether you're stashing the cash for tea and toast in your first home or catching some rays during retirement, Plum's got your back.

Since 2016, over 2 million people in 10 European markets have set aside more than £2 billion with our clever automation and AI - that's the magic of Plum! As recognition for our work, we've received awards from the likes of Deloitte, Finder, and more.

That's all down to our passionate team of 200+ Plumsters, who work around Europe to help us achieve our mission. And now we're looking for more brilliant people to join us on our journey.

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the team and help expand the value we deliver across Plum.

You will be part of a well established Product Analytics team, consisting of Data Analysts embedded across Product, Marketing and Operations, supporting the companies decision making through data.

What Will You Do


Become domain expert across an area at Plum, establishing yourself as the point of contact for analytical support
Help the teams you work with identify the opportunities (new features, products, bugs etc) they should focus on, by linking these to impact on the metrics of interest
Propose and define success KPIs and guide the teams towards data-driven decision making around these
Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Marketeers at Plum to impact size opportunities and estimate the impact these had once released
Produce deep dive analysis that influence the trajectory of the team's roadmap
Data modelling and analysis of key concepts, KPIs and patterns using dbt, BigQuery and SQL
Create interactive and informative dashboards and reports in Looker
Plan, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new product features against KPIs
Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to work on a modern Data platform (BigQuery, Looker, dbt), surrounded by an eclectic team of great Data professionals covering areas such as Product Analytics, Data Science and Data & Analytics Engineering



Who You Are


You have strong analytical intuition with a demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and extract actionable insights from data
You demonstrate ability to work independently and with rigour, whilst optimising for impact
You can collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing), translating business requirements into strong technical solutions
You value attention to detail and know how to balance quality and speed
You are impact driven, love a challenge, and have a self-starter mindset
You're team-oriented, keen to share your knowledge and grow professionally
Previous experience on Fintech, B2C digital businesses and/or fast-paced scale-up environments is very valued



Plum's Perks


Own part of the company you're helping grow through stock options
Private health insurance
Annual training budget
Plum Premium for free
Competitive referral scheme
Flexible approach to remote working: we encourage at least 2 days a week in one of our beautiful offices in London, Athens or Cyprus
Team breakfasts and team lunches
25 days holiday + bank holidays
45 work-from-anywhere days to give you flexibility to work your way
2 weeks sabbatical after 4 years to take the break you deserve
Enhanced parental leave
1 paid volunteering day annually
Annual team trip to a surprise destination!
A fun, inclusive company culture (think 🦄🌈💯)


If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don't hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum Τeam 💜


Plum is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Plum does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need
Show more

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into Head of Data Management you will deliver critical management information and analysis to allow our data managers identify data quality enhancements, monitor data usage and track supplier royalty costs. The quality of the analysis is of utmost importance, and decisions will be taken off the back of it. Alongside this you will directly manage a portfolio of data assets, with responsibility for the daily management including engaging with Product teams and the wider Experian UK&I business.

What You'll Do


End-to-End accountability for a nominated set of data assets throughout data lifecycle.
Maintain governance documentation (e.g. Record of Compliance, Data Handshakes) up to date.
Championing a culture that achieves goals, delights customers and keeps consumer advocacy at the heart of everything that Experian does.
Be the subject matter expert (SME) for your nominated data assets, supporting internal stakeholders looking for input, advice and granular detail.
Lead by example and follow all regulatory requirements and applying appropriate controls.
Support Data Owners with the curation of Management Information (MI) to ensure informed decisions around data usage, including trends and broader analysis.
Support regular MI requests for existing Data Office forums including Data Asset Reviews (DARs), Risk Management Meeting (RMG).
Ensure MI delivery is tested and validated to high level of accuracy.
Embrace your own curiosity around data, to highlight additional trends/insight to support better decisions.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Around 3 years of experience in a role which involves data management, manipulation or visualisation.
Experience with data manipulation tools such as SQL or Snowflake and/or data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to create dashboards that bring the data to life.
Education degree in Data, Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
Excellent written and verbal English.
Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices, deliverables and techniques for implementing enhanced data processing applications into a production environment, including knowledge of the data lifecycle stages.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here


Show more

We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into Head of Data Management you will deliver critical management information and analysis to allow our data managers identify data quality enhancements, monitor data usage and track supplier royalty costs. The quality of the analysis is of utmost importance, and decisions will be taken off the back of it. Alongside this you will directly manage a portfolio of data assets, with responsibility for the daily management including engaging with Product teams and the wider Experian UK&I business.

What You'll Do

  • End-to-End accountability for a nominated set of data assets throughout data lifecycle.
  • Maintain governance documentation (e.g. Record of Compliance, Data Handshakes) up to date.
  • Championing a culture that achieves goals, delights customers and keeps consumer advocacy at the heart of everything that Experian does.
  • Be the subject matter expert (SME) for your nominated data assets, supporting internal stakeholders looking for input, advice and granular detail.
  • Lead by example and follow all regulatory requirements and applying appropriate controls.
  • Support Data Owners with the curation of Management Information (MI) to ensure informed decisions around data usage, including trends and broader analysis.
  • Support regular MI requests for existing Data Office forums including Data Asset Reviews (DARs), Risk Management Meeting (RMG).
  • Ensure MI delivery is tested and validated to high level of accuracy.
  • Embrace your own curiosity around data, to highlight additional trends/insight to support better decisions.

Qualifications

What you'll bring:

  • Around 3 years of experience in a role which involves data management, manipulation or visualisation.
  • Experience with data manipulation tools such as SQL or Snowflake and/or data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to create dashboards that bring the data to life.
  • Education degree in Data, Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
  • Excellent written and verbal English.
  • Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices, deliverables and techniques for implementing enhanced data processing applications into a production environment, including knowledge of the data lifecycle stages.

Additional Information

You will get:

  • Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
  • Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Creditstar Group is a rapidly growing international consumer finance company, headquartered in Tallinn, Estonia and operating in multiple European markets.

At the core, we are a financial technology company that uses automated processes, algorithms and data analysis to make financial instruments easily available to a population of more than 175 million people in our target markets. We are a team of ambitious professionals who value innovation, effective efficiency, high growth, and high performance. For more information on the group, please visit www.creditstar.com.

Our vision is to build and deliver digital banking products of the future. If you want to be part of this, here is your chance.

YOUR ROLE:

As a valued member of our Product Analytics team, you will be responsible for analyzing our data, interpreting trends and patterns, building metrics and insights, and helping us make better business decisions across the group.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:


Being fully hands-on in applying your expertise in quantitative analysis, modeling, data mining, and presentation of data to deliver actionable insights and recommendations for the business
Regular quality monitoring of Installment Loan and Revolving credit products and proposing improvement ideas based on relevant analysis
Closely working with the Data, Engineering, and Risk teams to share data-related roadmaps and help drive data strategy
Develop ad-hoc reports and analyses to support Installment Loan and Revolving credit product needs



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong SQL knowledge - window functions, common table expressions, optimization techniques, clean code, etc
Experience with Power BI or any other BI tools
Experience with Python or R
Willingness to work in a fast-evolving environment
Fluency in spoken and written English
Passion about what you do



BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE:


Previous work experience in the Financial/Fintech sector
Experience with DAX expressions, Power BI Data Flows,Power Query, and Data Modeling
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics
Good MS Excel skills
Knowledge of Data Transformation tools like DBT
Knowledge Data Orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience working with Atlassian (Confluence, Jira)



Benefits


Dynamic, challenging, and rewarding work within a growing international company where one can REALLY make an impact;
Regular company parties and events;
Brand new office in the center of the city with games and free snacks/drinks;
Competitive remuneration package
Sports or health insurance compensation
Birthday day-off


Join us and contribute to our mission while advancing your career. Apply now!


Please note that this is not a remote position and requires to be present at the office at least 3 days a week.

Title: (Junior) BI Consultant
Description:
Job Description

Job summary: Support the BI strategy for our European NIQ clients, enabling them to self-serve using our tools. Scope, build and deliver solutions that meet their basic recurrent data needs. Leverage NIQ and third parties solutions to meet your value delivered target

Qualifications:


1-3 years of experience in client servicing in FMCG sector, especially in Business Intelligence
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluentcy in English
Proven experience in BI tools and data analysis such as Discover (NIQ) or PowerBI, Microstrategy
Previous experience working with: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Passion for learning and applying new technologies to business solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities
Building and maintaining effective work relationships
Good collaboration skills to meet client needs and achieve organizational goals
Ability to work in a remote-based environement


Key responsibilities:


Assist NIQ clients in understanding and utilizing BI tools effectively
Develop and propose BI solutions tailored to clients' recurrent data needs
Deliver on performance tracking and success measurement
Consult directly with clients and stakeholders on how to optimize uses of BI tools, applications for automation, analytics and reporting
Identify leads from client interactions, be able to channel these needs into business opportunities
Own end-to-end processes of in-scope reporting solutions across a variety of data sources (RMS, CPS, Omni)
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client requirements are met
Work closely with manager and team leaders to assist in day-to-day BI customer support needs, deployment activities and transformation initiatives
Aid in user education for platform-specific instruction to drive usage/adoption of Business Intelligence tools and supporting clients with our performance measurement services.
Share best demonstrated practices in an open, creative and inclusive team culture.
Collaborate with fellow BI and Insights teammates to identify business process improvements, project efficiencies and revenue opportunities.
Be active and engaged in continuous learning opportunities to upskill yourself, our team and advance our core areas of expertise.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Analista dati
Description:
Azienda & Valori:

Il nostro cliente è una multinazionale leader nel settore oil & gas, con una presenza consolidata a livello globale. La sede italiana, situata in Milano, zona centrale, è il cuore delle operazioni commerciali e amministrative del gruppo per l'Europa. L'azienda promuove un ambiente di lavoro dinamico, innovativo e inclusivo, con un forte focus sulla crescita e lo sviluppo delle competenze dei propri dipendenti.




Titolo della posizione:

Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale (M/F/D)




Finalità del Ruolo:

Il Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale avrà la responsabilità di gestire l’inserimento e la validazione dei dati commerciali e di supportare l’analisi dei dati per il monitoraggio delle performance aziendali. Il candidato sarà il punto di riferimento per la gestione delle informazioni legate ai dati di vendita e ai report commerciali, lavorando a stretto contatto con il team vendite e l’area finance. Sarà cruciale l’abilità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight utili per ottimizzare le strategie commerciali.




Tasks:

• Inserire, validare e aggiornare i dati relativi alle vendite e ai clienti all'interno del sistema gestionale aziendale, garantendo accuratezza e tempestività.

• Utilizzare Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato, con una solida padronanza di tabelle pivot, funzioni avanzate e macro per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati.

• Creare e aggiornare report commerciali periodici, monitorando le performance di vendita, il raggiungimento degli obiettivi e i KPI.

• Collaborare con il team commerciale per l’analisi delle previsioni di vendita e l’andamento dei mercati, supportando la definizione di strategie di miglioramento.

• Identificare anomalie o discrepanze nei dati, proponendo soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza del processo di data entry e di analisi.

• Supportare il team nella gestione di grandi volumi di dati, provenienti da diverse fonti, e nella loro integrazione in report consolidati.

• Partecipare alla creazione di dashboard interattive utilizzando strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI o Tableau, per fornire visualizzazioni intuitive e dinamiche delle informazioni aziendali.

• Fornire insight utili e proposte basate sui dati per ottimizzare le strategie di vendita e migliorare l’efficienza operativa.




Relazioni funzionali:

Interne: Collaborazione diretta con il team vendite, l'area finance e il reparto IT per la gestione dei dati e dei flussi di informazioni.
Esterne: Occasionali interazioni con partner esterni o fornitori di software per l'integrazione di nuove soluzioni di analisi e data entry.




Funzioni Primarie:

• Inserimento, gestione e validazione dei dati commerciali.

• Creazione e aggiornamento di report commerciali e analisi delle performance di vendita.

• Collaborazione con il team vendite per l’ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali.

• Utilizzo avanzato di Excel, con particolare focus su tabelle pivot, macro e funzioni avanzate.

• Utilizzo di strumenti di business intelligence per la creazione di dashboard e visualizzazioni dati.




Formazione e Competenze:

Il candidato ideale possiede una Laurea in Data Analytics, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini. È richiesta una solida esperienza nell’uso di Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato e di strumenti di data analysis. La familiarità con strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti costituisce un plus, così come l’esperienza nella gestione di dati in contesti aziendali complessi.




Hard Skills:

• Competenze avanzate nell'uso di Microsoft Excel (tabelle pivot, macro, funzioni avanzate).

• Capacità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight strategici.

• Esperienza nella creazione di report commerciali e nella gestione dei KPI.

• Conoscenza di strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.

• Competenze nel data entry e nella validazione dei dati.

• Esperienza nell’automazione dei processi di analisi e reporting.




Soft Skills:

• Eccellenti capacità di analisi e problem-solving.

• Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli nella gestione dei dati.

• Ottime capacità di collaborazione e comunicazione con team interni.

• Proattività nel migliorare processi e flussi di lavoro.

• Flessibilità e capacità di adattamento in un ambiente dinamico e in costante evoluzione.




Cosa Offre il nostro Committente:

L'azienda offre un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e un ambiente di lavoro flessibile e innovativo:

• RAL fino a 35.000€: La retribuzione annua lorda massima prevista è di 35.000€, commisurata all’esperienza del candidato.

• Smart Working 2 giorni a settimana: Possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida, garantendo un equilibrio tra vita privata e lavorativa.

• Assicurazione Sanitaria Fondo Est: Copertura sanitaria estesa per il benessere del dipendente.

• Ticket Restaurant: Buoni pasto giornalieri da 9€ per ogni giorno lavorato.

• Accesso al welfare aziendale: Iniziative e programmi di welfare volti a migliorare la qualità della vita lavorativa.

• Formazione Continua: Opportunità di crescita e aggiornamento delle competenze, con accesso a percorsi di formazione e sviluppo professionale.




L'offerta è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, nonché a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

I dati personali saranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (GDPR) e della normativa nazionale vigente in materia di protezione dei dati personali. Il trattamento dei dati avverrà con modalità e strumenti idonei a garantire la riservatezza e la sicurezza degli stessi, secondo le finalità indicate nell’informativa privacy che sarà fornita ai candidati. Inviando il proprio curriculum vitae, il candidato autorizza espressamente il trattamento dei dati ai sensi della suddetta normativa e dichiara di aver preso visione dell’informativa sulla privacy.

Title: ALTERNANCE - Assistant Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Poste

From the house of dream to the house of talents

« Quoi que vous fassiez - pour le travail ou le plaisir - faites-le avec passion ! Vivez avec passion... »* Christian Dior

Christian Dior fut le couturier du rêve. Dès la fondation de sa Maison en 1947, marquée par la révolution du New Look, il métamorphose ses songes en de merveilleuses créations. Son esprit visionnaire n’a eu de cesse de magnifier les femmes du monde entier, inspirant aujourd’hui et plus que jamais ses successeurs. « Le tissu est le seul véhicule de nos rêves (…). La mode, en somme, est issue d’un rêve, et le rêve, c’est une évasion », écrivait-il dans son ouvrage Je suis couturier. Au fil de ses collections, Monsieur Dior est devenu le démiurge du bonheur de ses muses.

Aujourd’hui, riche de cet héritage d’exception et d’une communauté de plus de 7 500 talents, notre Maison incarne plus que jamais la Maison des Talents pensé par Christian Dior. Dans plus de 40 pays, nous faisons rayonner notre savoir-faire, notre audace et notre excellence à travers la passion et la créativité de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous et créez votre avenir dans notre univers généreux, disruptif et ambitieux où nous grandissons dans l’excellence, le courage et l’optimisme.


Le Petit Dictionnaire de la Mode


Missions

DETAIL DE LA MISSION

Contexte

Au sein de l’Analytics Factory (siège Monde), vous assisterez l’équipe dans la production et l’analyse des données clients afin d’aider aux prises de décisions. Vous serez amené à être en contact avec nos interlocuteurs en Zone ainsi que les divisions Produits et équipes Marketing Client, dans le but de les soutenir dans leur suivi client.

Descriptif

En fonction de votre profil, nous pourrons définir une mission principale : réalisation d’un score d’appétence produits, retravailler la segmentation clients actuelle, affiner la définition des clients inactifs pour mettre en place des traitements différenciés, …

En Périphérie De Cette Mission Principale, Vous Participerez à La Production Et à L’analyse Quotidiennes Des Données Clients


Réalisation d’études et d’analyses clients (analyse du comportement d’achat, profils clients, parcours clients, segmentations)
Analyses des performances des produits et des collections (ventes, tendances, recrutement etc.)
Gestion opérationnelle des campagnes marketing : recommandation de ciblage, comptages et créations
Mise en place de tableaux de bord afin de suivre la performance des campagnes (newsletters, mailing…)
Analyse des impacts des différentes actions clientèles monde (événements clients, …)


Profil

De formation Bac+5, type école d’ingénieur ou université spécialisée en statistiques


Dataiku / SQL indispensable
Rigueur, fiabilité et autonomie
Esprit d’équipe
Anglais indispensable


Ce que vous apprendrez au cours de cette alternance :

Vous pourrez développer vos compétences analytiques (lecture de résultats, analyse et communication pertinente des enseignements).

Vous aurez également l’occasion de mettre en application vos compétences statistiques à l’aide notamment de Dataiku, dont vous pourrez de plus améliorer votre maîtrise.

Vous participerez à la vie courante d’un grand groupe de luxe, en découvrirez l’univers et les problématiques clients.

A titre personnel, vous développerez vos compétences relationnelles au contact des différentes équipes en Zone, Marketing Client et des divisions Produit, ainsi que votre rigueur et votre autonomie.

Encourageant l’inclusion et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, Christian Dior Couture s'est engagé depuis 2013 dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, et de la valorisation de toutes les singularités.
Show more
HTML:
Poste

From the house of dream to the house of talents

« Quoi que vous fassiez - pour le travail ou le plaisir - faites-le avec passion ! Vivez avec passion... »* Christian Dior

Christian Dior fut le couturier du rêve. Dès la fondation de sa Maison en 1947, marquée par la révolution du New Look, il métamorphose ses songes en de merveilleuses créations. Son esprit visionnaire n’a eu de cesse de magnifier les femmes du monde entier, inspirant aujourd’hui et plus que jamais ses successeurs. « Le tissu est le seul véhicule de nos rêves (…). La mode, en somme, est issue d’un rêve, et le rêve, c’est une évasion », écrivait-il dans son ouvrage Je suis couturier. Au fil de ses collections, Monsieur Dior est devenu le démiurge du bonheur de ses muses.

Aujourd’hui, riche de cet héritage d’exception et d’une communauté de plus de 7 500 talents, notre Maison incarne plus que jamais la Maison des Talents pensé par Christian Dior. Dans plus de 40 pays, nous faisons rayonner notre savoir-faire, notre audace et notre excellence à travers la passion et la créativité de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous et créez votre avenir dans notre univers généreux, disruptif et ambitieux où nous grandissons dans l’excellence, le courage et l’optimisme.

  • Le Petit Dictionnaire de la Mode

Missions

DETAIL DE LA MISSION

Contexte

Au sein de l’Analytics Factory (siège Monde), vous assisterez l’équipe dans la production et l’analyse des données clients afin d’aider aux prises de décisions. Vous serez amené à être en contact avec nos interlocuteurs en Zone ainsi que les divisions Produits et équipes Marketing Client, dans le but de les soutenir dans leur suivi client.

Descriptif

En fonction de votre profil, nous pourrons définir une mission principale : réalisation d’un score d’appétence produits, retravailler la segmentation clients actuelle, affiner la définition des clients inactifs pour mettre en place des traitements différenciés, …

En Périphérie De Cette Mission Principale, Vous Participerez à La Production Et à L’analyse Quotidiennes Des Données Clients

  • Réalisation d’études et d’analyses clients (analyse du comportement d’achat, profils clients, parcours clients, segmentations)
  • Analyses des performances des produits et des collections (ventes, tendances, recrutement etc.)
  • Gestion opérationnelle des campagnes marketing : recommandation de ciblage, comptages et créations
  • Mise en place de tableaux de bord afin de suivre la performance des campagnes (newsletters, mailing…)
  • Analyse des impacts des différentes actions clientèles monde (événements clients, …)

Profil

De formation Bac+5, type école d’ingénieur ou université spécialisée en statistiques

  • Dataiku / SQL indispensable
  • Rigueur, fiabilité et autonomie
  • Esprit d’équipe
  • Anglais indispensable

Ce que vous apprendrez au cours de cette alternance :

Vous pourrez développer vos compétences analytiques (lecture de résultats, analyse et communication pertinente des enseignements).

Vous aurez également l’occasion de mettre en application vos compétences statistiques à l’aide notamment de Dataiku, dont vous pourrez de plus améliorer votre maîtrise.

Vous participerez à la vie courante d’un grand groupe de luxe, en découvrirez l’univers et les problématiques clients.

A titre personnel, vous développerez vos compétences relationnelles au contact des différentes équipes en Zone, Marketing Client et des divisions Produit, ainsi que votre rigueur et votre autonomie.

Encourageant l’inclusion et la diversité sous toutes ses formes, Christian Dior Couture s'est engagé depuis 2013 dans une démarche en faveur de l'emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, et de la valorisation de toutes les singularités.

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a Middle Data Analyst to join our analytics team. You will help us understand and improve our promo campaigns. If you have experience in iGaming or Betting, know how to use analytics tools, and understand business needs — we would be happy to see you in our team.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in a casino or betting company (optional: mobile games with P2W model or traffic acquisition);
  • Good skills in SQL, AWS (Athena, S3), Tableau (Desktop and Prep), Excel, and Google Sheets;
  • Experience working with DWH or backend teams, and with product managers;
  • Experience with B2B business models or understanding how they work is a plus;
  • Practical knowledge of Google Analytics and Python;
  • Good communication and organizational skills;
  • Optional: experience in A/B testing;
  • English level: B1


Responsibilities

  • Make reports and analysis for promo campaigns;
  • Work closely with the product analytics team;
  • Organize and lead weekly meetings with promo team managers to show and explain campaign results;
  • Do ad-hoc analysis and create visual reports;
  • Write short and clear documentation in Confluence about your analysis and methods


Benefits

🎰 Be part of the international iGaming industry - Work with a top European solution provider and shape the future of online gaming;

💕 A Collaborative Culture - Join a supportive and understanding team;

💰 Competitive salary and bonus system - Enjoy additional rewards on top of your base salary;

📆 Unlimited vacation & sick leave - Because we prioritize your well-being;

📈 Professional Development - Access a dedicated budget for self-development and learning;

🏥 Healthcare coverage - Available for employees in Ukraine and compensation across the EU;

🫂 Mental health support - Free consultations with a corporate psychologist;

🇬🇧 Language learning support - We cover the cost of foreign language courses;

🎁 Celebrating Your Milestones - Special gifts for life's important moments;

⏳ Flexible working hours - Start your day anytime between 9:00-11:00 AM;

🏢 Flexible Work Arrangements - Choose between remote, office, or hybrid work;

🖥 Modern Tech Setup - Get the tools you need to perform at your best;

🚚 Relocation support - Assistance provided if you move to one of our hubs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Alma shapes the fintech landscape. We strive to serve and empower consumers and merchants by developing innovative solutions that redefine their purchase experience.

About The Job

As a member of our Central Data Analytics team, you'll hold a full stack and cross-functional position that bridges our data engineers and our business teams. With a focus on Marketing, you'll play a crucial role in enhancing decision-making across the company.

Reporting directly to the Head of Data, you'll be instrumental in leveraging our data as a significant asset to outpace our competitors.

As a Data Analyst in the Central Data team, your key responsibilities are:


Build the products that will empower our teams to monitor their key performance indicators and drive accountability (i.e. developing models and reports for revenue marketing streams (attribution modelling, budget definition), aiding in ROI measurement and spend optimisation)
Transform complex business problematics into clear data driven solutions with actionable business outcomes
Maintain high standards on data quality by owning data processes and best practices
Help and train our business analysts to understand our data and use our tools



Our technical stack: GCP / Big Query / Airflow / dbt / Looker / Metabase / Python

What makes you the perfect fit for the role?

Mandatory requirements:


Education: Master's degree from an Engineering or a Business school and in relevant fields (i.e. Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Business)
Experience: 1-3 years of experience in a Data Analyst role
Language: full professional proficiency in English (Full professional proficiency in French is optional but will be a huge plus!)
Technical skills: solid experience in data visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau,...) and languages (SQL, Python), and good understanding in data architecture principles
Great communicator: excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex findings in a clear and understandable way



Soft skills:


You are autonomous, rigorous and detail-oriented
You are data-driven: you are at ease with defining metrics to drive business decisions
You are a problem solver: you love to investigate issues and identify the root causes of problems in order to identify appropriate solutions
You have an analytical mindset: you are able to breakdown a big problem into smaller ones to solve them
You are customer obsessed: you are able to put yourself in our users’ shoes and come up with creative ideas to improve their experience
You have an entrepreneurial mindset: you do not hesitate to take ownership and “get your hands dirty”



About The Recruitment Process


Phone interview with Recruiter (30 mins)
Interview with Hiring Manager and 1 Data Analyst (60 mins)
Take-home Business Case Study, following by On-site / Remote presentation with 2 Data Analysts (60 mins)
Final interview with Head of Marketing Revenue (30 mins)

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Somos Métrica, una consultora de negocio, integración de sistemas, servicios y soluciones IT, comprometida con la Sociedad de la información y el desarrollo tecnológico.

¿Te apasiona trabajar con datos, automatizar procesos y ser parte de proyectos que realmente aportan valor?

En Métrica estamos buscando a alguien como tú: curioso, con mentalidad analítica y muchas ganas de crecer. Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo un/a Data Analyst con entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia para colaborar en un proyecto puntero con un cliente referente en el sector.

Desde el primer día formarás parte de un entorno colaborativo donde tus ideas cuentan. Estarás acompañado por profesionales expertos que te guiarán y te ayudarán a potenciar tu carrera.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?

🔍 Experiencia en desarrollo de pipelines ETL con Apache Spark y Python.

☁️ Conocimiento práctico de servicios AWS como S3, RDS (PostgreSQL), IAM, Glue, EMR y Lambda.

🧠 Buen dominio de SQL.

🔧 Familiaridad con herramientas de control de versiones y flujos CI/CD.

⚡ Se valorará experiencia con procesamiento de datos en tiempo real.

📜 Certificaciones AWS en datos o arquitecturas cloud (deseable).

💹 Conocimientos en inversiones y banca privada (deseable).

🌍 Nivel de inglés intermedio o superior (deseable).

¿Qué te ofrecemos? 😎

📰 Contrato indefinido desde el inicio.

🏥 Acceso a un plan de retribución flexible.

👩‍🎓 Formación continua en las áreas que te interesen.

👨‍💻 Modalidad 100% remoto: trabaja desde donde estés.




En Métrica queremos ayudarte a dar el siguiente paso en tu carrera.

📧 ¡Contáctanos o envíanos tu CV!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Only candidates with INSURANCE industry experience will be considered for this role







Are you ready to turn complex data into powerful insights that shape strategic decisions? A leading insurance client of ours is seeking a skilled and driven Data Analyst to join their high-performing IT team. We are looking at candidates that have insurance experience and are truly passionate about data!




Responsibilities

Analyze data sets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights, delivering clear and compelling reports to stakeholders
Design, develop, and maintain complex queries and reporting tools across various platforms
Produce scheduled and ad hoc reports tailored to the needs of internal teams and external partners
Maintain and enhance the current reporting suite, ensuring accuracy and relevance of filters and datasets
Collaborate closely with business teams to support data-driven strategy and forecasting
Partner with senior leadership to prioritize data initiatives and align reporting with business goals
Act as the main point of contact for third-party service providers and capital partners, attending relevant meetings and calls
Continuously seek out process improvements to enhance efficiency and data quality across reporting systems




Candidate Requirements

3+ years of experience in the Analytics space
Proven commercial experience within the Insurance industry is essential
Proven track record in SQL query writing for reporting and ad hoc data exploration
Advanced skills in reporting tools such as Power BI, SSRS, and Excel (including Macros)
Solid understanding of the data lifecycle, with the ability to manage and optimize data in SQL databases
Exceptional analytical thinking, with the ability to explain insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills, comfortable engaging with executives and external partners
Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Randstad Digital is at the forefront of transforming the digital landscape, committed to delivering exceptional outcomes for our clients' businesses and their customers. With over 25,000 engineers and digital experts worldwide, we specialize in accelerating digital enablement across various industries. Join us and be part of a talent-first organization.







We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to work on a cloud-based platform that simplifies the subscription of digital services for fleets. This platform offers comprehensive solutions for fleet management, including real-time vehicle position tracking, cruising speed updates, and driving parameter analytics to calculate driver performance and identify vehicle performance patterns.







Responsibilities:

Conduct data analysis on large datasets, including necessary cleaning and preparation steps.
Apply statistical methods such as descriptive statistics, data profiling, and validation.
Explore data to identify patterns, relationships, anomalies, and trends.
Analyze and break down complex problems into manageable parts and actionable insights.
Use logic and reasoning to draw meaningful conclusions from data.
Prepare and deliver presentations to effectively communicate complex ideas and results.
Collaborate cross-functionally with different teams to ensure insights align with team strategies.
Share findings and methodologies openly to support team members and the broader organization.
Document data quality issues and provide actionable recommendations.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.




Qualifications:




5 to 7 years of experience
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
Knowledge of Python or other programming languages used in data analysis.
Familiarity with data quality dimensions and best practices.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Hands-on experience with big data technologies, for example, PySpark and distributed storage/processing systems.
Familiarity with ETL tools and building data pipelines.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and services (AWS experience is a plus).

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( 1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Lisbon (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Client's team on a hybrid working model from Lisbon.




Position Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in providing data analysis and reporting tools to teams like VERDI. Your responsibilities will include data extraction, processing, and delivery to support decision-making and enhance the user experience. This collaborative role will involve working closely with teams to ensure high data quality while addressing recurring and ad hoc business needs.




Key Responsibilities

Build and optimize ETL data pipelines using Apache Airflow.
Fine-tune SQL queries and Python scripts for enhanced performance.
Generate actionable insights and identify emerging trends through data analysis.
Deliver data outputs in an attractive and functional format for stakeholders.
Understand business requirements and assess their impacts to guide data solutions.
Continuously ensure the accuracy and quality of data and provide ongoing support to the team.




Required Skills

Advanced Python for scripting and analytics 🐍.
Advanced SQL with Oracle (mandatory); SQL Server and PostgreSQL (preferred).
Experience with PySpark and Data Warehouses.
Familiarity with Agile (SCRUM) methodologies.
Knowledge of Apache Airflow (desired).
Fluent English (mandatory).




Bonus Skills:

Version control with GIT.
Experience with Parquet file format.
Ability to create APIs in Python.




Why Join Us?

Employment: Indefinite Contract from the start.
Health Insurance: Comprehensive coverage for your well-being.
Hybrid Work Model: 2 days on-site, 3 days remote.
Continuous Learning: Access to a Udemy Business subscription with thousands of workshops and courses.
Team Culture: Collaborative and innovative work environment.




If you meet the above criteria and are ready for an exciting opportunity in a dynamic environment, submit your CV!
