Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

Title: Data Analyst - Visualización & Negocio (Barcelona)
Description:
Únete a nosotros y forma parte del futuro de BCNC Group🚀




Somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, Reino Unido, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos. #WeHaveOurOwnCode




🔍Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en visualización de datos con enfoque en la generación de valor a negocio a través del análisis de datos trabajando codo a codo con las áreas estratégicas en una empresa referente del sector servicios con gran volumen de usuarios.




✨Qué harás en tu día a día:

Diseñar y construir dashboards claros, visuales y útiles que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Generar storytelling con datos, facilitando la interpretación de la información para las áreas de negocio.
Colaborar de forma estrecha con el Product Owner y con los equipos comerciales y de operaciones, entendiendo sus procesos y retos.
Proponer mejoras y accionables a partir de los datos disponibles.
Promover buenas prácticas en el uso y consumo de la información, con mirada crítica y enfoque en la mejora continua.




✨Qué aspectos claves esperamos de ti:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como analista de datos en proyectos recientes.
Dominio de herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Colaboración estrecha con equipos de negocio para comprender necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones visuales. Se valora capacidad analítica, sentido visual y orientación a la claridad en los datos.
Proactividad y orientación al impacto: no buscamos solo alguien que entregue dashboards, sino que aporte valor desde el análisis.
Trabajo en entornos ágiles (Scrum) y equipos multidisciplinares.




✨Que tenemos para ti:

🤝Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

👩‍💻Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

⌚Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

✨Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

📖Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

🤩Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

🌴Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

🙌🏻Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




Y sobre todo… un buen entorno laboral: nuestros colaboradores puntúan un 4.7 sobre 5 su experiencia en BCNC Group!




Te queremos conocer...

Title: Data Analyst Power BI Remoto
Description:
Somos Plexus Tech. Una compañía tecnológica especializada en servicios y productos IT, fundada en el talento y las capacidades de nuestra gente, más de 3.000 profesionales desarrollando tecnología con alma.




¡Ampliamos nuestros equipos! ¡Buscamos talento!




¿Te animas a seguir formándote en tecnologías punteras y vanguardiastas en el Mercado? entonces, debes unirte a la familia Plexus. Si te gusta progresar y acometer nuevos retos esta es tu oportunidad.




En Plexus nos encontramos en búsqueda de Pefil Sr Data Analyst para un importante proyecto en Mallorca




Experiencia laboral de mínimo cinco años en puesto similar

Experiencia en bases de datos relacionales, con un dominio sólido de SQL y PL/SQL.

Conocimientos avanzados en Power BI (DAX, Power Query)

Experiencia mínima de 3 años trabajando con herramientas de Visualización de Datos.

Conocimientos en entornos Cloud AWS y/o Azure.

Conocimiento en Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps)

Conocimientos en Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, Pipelines y Notebooks)




Valorable:

Experiencia en proyectos de BI, diseñando y utilizando modelos de copo de nieve o estrella.

Conocimiento en Azure Data Factory.

Conocimiento de bases de datos NoSQL.

Residencia en Mallorca, Baleares.

Funciones:

Desarrollar las capacidades analíticas que soportan la toma de decisiones fundamentadas en el dato.

Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con ingenieros de datos, proporcionando necesidades y especificaciones para crear estructuras de recopilación de datos, informes de datos y visualización de datos

Diseñar soluciones efectivas en modelo de datos que optimicen el rendimiento.

Mantener y evolucionar los dashboard en producción.

Modelar dimensiones, hechos y jerarquías en herramientas de BI.

Crear KPI, informes y cuadros de mando que aporten valor para los usuarios finales.

Interactuar con los usuarios para resolver problemas y colaborar en la mejora de informes y cuadros de mando.







Si tienes inquietud en poder seguir progresando este es tu proyecto!!!!!




Te unirás a un equipo de más de 3.000 profesionales

Podrás impulsar tu proyección profesional con nosotros/as.

Acceso a formación continuada

Formar parte de un equipo dinámico, comprometido, apasionado por sus clientes y con ganas de dar lo mejor de sí mismo.

Formar parte de una compañía con muchos profesionales de referencia en el sector

Un ecosistema de trabajo con un ambiente colaborativo.




Contratación indefinida+salario a convenir

Paquete de retribución Flexible

Seguro médico

Ticket Restaurante

Ticket transporte

Ticket guardería




Nos apasiona la tecnología, pero sobre todo nos encantan las personas que la hacen posible. Porque con motivación, ilusión y trabajo en equipo estamos haciendo cosas maravillosas.




Plexus Tech mantiene un compromiso firme con las políticas de Igualdad de empresa. Todos nuestros procesos de selección tienen en cuenta la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres de forma transversal, quedando esto reflejado en nuestro Plan de Igualdad.

Title: Data analyst in controlling
HTML:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference.

Work



Job Description

Job Description

Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports;
  • Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights;
  • Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders;
  • Manage the deployment of BI solutions, ensuring they are user-friendly and accessible to all relevant parties within the organization;
  • Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and advancements in BI technology, recommending improvements to tools and processes;
  • Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture;





Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.;
  • Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential;
  • Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies;
  • Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis;
  • Ability to work with large, complex data sets and transform them into insightful business information;
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently;
  • Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude;

Additional Information

Benefits:

  • 25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
  • Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
  • Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
  • Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
  • Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
  • Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
  • Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
  • Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
  • Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
  • Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
  • Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
  • Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
  • Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
  • Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
  • Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
  • Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant

Application Process

After you followed all the required steps on our platform, you will receive an e-mail for GDPR compliance.

Only those applicants who give their agreement will receive feedback from us.

Any other questions? Feel free to e-mail me at ioana.ilea@ro.bosch.com I will be back with an answer shortly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst, for a project based in Lisbon.




Responsabilities:

Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support




Requirements:

Advanced Python (Mandatory)
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark (Mandatory)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Apache Airflow (Desirable experience in pipeline development)
Agile methodologies (Scrum)
Git (Is a plus)
Experience with Parquet file format (Is a plus)
Experience in creating APIs in Python (Is a plus)
Fluent in English (written and oral)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to or liliana.moreno@decskill.com with reference “LM/Data Analyst”.




#letsgrowtogether 🚀




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hey! We're Plum, your smart saving and investing app on a mission to help grow money for life. Whether you're stashing the cash for tea and toast in your first home or catching some rays during retirement, Plum's got your back.

Since 2016, over 2 million people in 10 European markets have set aside more than £2 billion with our clever automation and AI - that's the magic of Plum! As recognition for our work, we've received awards from the likes of Deloitte, Finder, and more.

That's all down to our passionate team of 200+ Plumsters, who work around Europe to help us achieve our mission. And now we're looking for more brilliant people to join us on our journey.

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the team and help expand the value we deliver across Plum.

You will be part of a well established Product Analytics team, consisting of Data Analysts embedded across Product, Marketing and Operations, supporting the companies decision making through data.

What Will You Do


Become domain expert across an area at Plum, establishing yourself as the point of contact for analytical support
Help the teams you work with identify the opportunities (new features, products, bugs etc) they should focus on, by linking these to impact on the metrics of interest
Propose and define success KPIs and guide the teams towards data-driven decision making around these
Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Marketeers at Plum to impact size opportunities and estimate the impact these had once released
Produce deep dive analysis that influence the trajectory of the team's roadmap
Data modelling and analysis of key concepts, KPIs and patterns using dbt, BigQuery and SQL
Create interactive and informative dashboards and reports in Looker
Plan, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new product features against KPIs
Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to work on a modern Data platform (BigQuery, Looker, dbt), surrounded by an eclectic team of great Data professionals covering areas such as Product Analytics, Data Science and Data & Analytics Engineering



Who You Are


You have strong analytical intuition with a demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and extract actionable insights from data
You demonstrate ability to work independently and with rigour, whilst optimising for impact
You can collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing), translating business requirements into strong technical solutions
You value attention to detail and know how to balance quality and speed
You are impact driven, love a challenge, and have a self-starter mindset
You're team-oriented, keen to share your knowledge and grow professionally
Previous experience on Fintech, B2C digital businesses and/or fast-paced scale-up environments is very valued



Plum's Perks


Own part of the company you're helping grow through stock options
Private health insurance
Annual training budget
Plum Premium for free
Competitive referral scheme
Flexible approach to remote working: we encourage at least 2 days a week in one of our beautiful offices in London, Athens or Cyprus
Team breakfasts and team lunches
25 days holiday + bank holidays
45 work-from-anywhere days to give you flexibility to work your way
2 weeks sabbatical after 4 years to take the break you deserve
Enhanced parental leave
1 paid volunteering day annually
Annual team trip to a surprise destination!
A fun, inclusive company culture (think 🦄🌈💯)


If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don't hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum Τeam 💜


Plum is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Plum does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need
Show more
HTML:
Hey! We're Plum, your smart saving and investing app on a mission to help grow money for life. Whether you're stashing the cash for tea and toast in your first home or catching some rays during retirement, Plum's got your back.

Since 2016, over 2 million people in 10 European markets have set aside more than £2 billion with our clever automation and AI - that's the magic of Plum! As recognition for our work, we've received awards from the likes of Deloitte, Finder, and more.

That's all down to our passionate team of 200+ Plumsters, who work around Europe to help us achieve our mission. And now we're looking for more brilliant people to join us on our journey.

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the team and help expand the value we deliver across Plum.

You will be part of a well established Product Analytics team, consisting of Data Analysts embedded across Product, Marketing and Operations, supporting the companies decision making through data.

What Will You Do

  • Become domain expert across an area at Plum, establishing yourself as the point of contact for analytical support
  • Help the teams you work with identify the opportunities (new features, products, bugs etc) they should focus on, by linking these to impact on the metrics of interest
  • Propose and define success KPIs and guide the teams towards data-driven decision making around these
  • Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Marketeers at Plum to impact size opportunities and estimate the impact these had once released
  • Produce deep dive analysis that influence the trajectory of the team's roadmap
  • Data modelling and analysis of key concepts, KPIs and patterns using dbt, BigQuery and SQL
  • Create interactive and informative dashboards and reports in Looker
  • Plan, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new product features against KPIs
  • Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to work on a modern Data platform (BigQuery, Looker, dbt), surrounded by an eclectic team of great Data professionals covering areas such as Product Analytics, Data Science and Data & Analytics Engineering


Who You Are

  • You have strong analytical intuition with a demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and extract actionable insights from data
  • You demonstrate ability to work independently and with rigour, whilst optimising for impact
  • You can collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing), translating business requirements into strong technical solutions
  • You value attention to detail and know how to balance quality and speed
  • You are impact driven, love a challenge, and have a self-starter mindset
  • You're team-oriented, keen to share your knowledge and grow professionally
  • Previous experience on Fintech, B2C digital businesses and/or fast-paced scale-up environments is very valued


Plum's Perks

  • Own part of the company you're helping grow through stock options
  • Private health insurance
  • Annual training budget
  • Plum Premium for free
  • Competitive referral scheme
  • Flexible approach to remote working: we encourage at least 2 days a week in one of our beautiful offices in London, Athens or Cyprus
  • Team breakfasts and team lunches
  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays
  • 45 work-from-anywhere days to give you flexibility to work your way
  • 2 weeks sabbatical after 4 years to take the break you deserve
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 1 paid volunteering day annually
  • Annual team trip to a surprise destination!
  • A fun, inclusive company culture (think 🦄🌈💯)

If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don't hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum Τeam 💜

  • Plum is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Plum does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into Head of Data Management you will deliver critical management information and analysis to allow our data managers identify data quality enhancements, monitor data usage and track supplier royalty costs. The quality of the analysis is of utmost importance, and decisions will be taken off the back of it. Alongside this you will directly manage a portfolio of data assets, with responsibility for the daily management including engaging with Product teams and the wider Experian UK&I business.

What You'll Do


End-to-End accountability for a nominated set of data assets throughout data lifecycle.
Maintain governance documentation (e.g. Record of Compliance, Data Handshakes) up to date.
Championing a culture that achieves goals, delights customers and keeps consumer advocacy at the heart of everything that Experian does.
Be the subject matter expert (SME) for your nominated data assets, supporting internal stakeholders looking for input, advice and granular detail.
Lead by example and follow all regulatory requirements and applying appropriate controls.
Support Data Owners with the curation of Management Information (MI) to ensure informed decisions around data usage, including trends and broader analysis.
Support regular MI requests for existing Data Office forums including Data Asset Reviews (DARs), Risk Management Meeting (RMG).
Ensure MI delivery is tested and validated to high level of accuracy.
Embrace your own curiosity around data, to highlight additional trends/insight to support better decisions.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Around 3 years of experience in a role which involves data management, manipulation or visualisation.
Experience with data manipulation tools such as SQL or Snowflake and/or data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to create dashboards that bring the data to life.
Education degree in Data, Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
Excellent written and verbal English.
Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices, deliverables and techniques for implementing enhanced data processing applications into a production environment, including knowledge of the data lifecycle stages.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here


Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Mit Grundkenntnissen in der Luftfahrt




WePlan ist ein innovatives Unternehmen, das wegweisende Lösungen für die strategische und mehrjährige Personalplanung entwickelt. Mit unserem derzeitigen Kundenstamm in der Reise-, Transport- und Logistikbranche wachsen wir stetig und erweitern kontinuierlich unser Netzwerk. Dafür suchen wir motivierte Teamplayer, die mit uns gemeinsam die Zukunft gestalten möchten.




Deine Aufgaben:




Datenanalyse: Erstelle und pflege Dashboards sowie Berichte, um unseren Kunden datenbasierte Einblicke zu bieten
Optimierung: Analysiere komplexe Datenstrukturen und leite Handlungsempfehlungen zur Optimierung der Personalplanung ab
Entwicklung: Wirke bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenmodellen mit, die unsere Prozesse verbessern
Ad-hoc-Analysen: Unterstütze Entscheidungsprozesse durch die Durchführung spezifischer Datenanalysen
Zusammenarbeit: Arbeite eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um Datenbedürfnisse zu identifizieren und innovative Lösungen zu entwickeln




Dein Profil:




Akademischer Hintergrund: Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen Bereich
Praktische Erfahrung: Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise mit Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI
Excel-Expertise: Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel, ergänzt durch SQL-Kenntnisse; Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Teamorientierung: Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen und dynamischen Team




Was wir bieten:




Flexibles Arbeiten: Möglichkeit, überwiegend remote zu arbeiten (4 Tage pro Woche)
Zentrale Lage: Unser Büro befindet sich im Herzen von Frankfurt, mit Zugang zu Open Office Spaces in ganz Deutschland
Attraktive Vorteile: Genieße ein kostenloses Ticket für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr, kostenlose Getränke und exklusive Catering-Angebote
Top-Ausstattung: Wir stellen die neueste Apple-Hardware bereit und bieten zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung




Bewirb dich jetzt!




Wenn du Teil eines innovativen Teams werden und zur Entwicklung wegweisender Lösungen beitragen möchtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Creditstar Group is a rapidly growing international consumer finance company, headquartered in Tallinn, Estonia and operating in multiple European markets.

At the core, we are a financial technology company that uses automated processes, algorithms and data analysis to make financial instruments easily available to a population of more than 175 million people in our target markets. We are a team of ambitious professionals who value innovation, effective efficiency, high growth, and high performance. For more information on the group, please visit www.creditstar.com.

Our vision is to build and deliver digital banking products of the future. If you want to be part of this, here is your chance.

YOUR ROLE:

As a valued member of our Product Analytics team, you will be responsible for analyzing our data, interpreting trends and patterns, building metrics and insights, and helping us make better business decisions across the group.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:


Being fully hands-on in applying your expertise in quantitative analysis, modeling, data mining, and presentation of data to deliver actionable insights and recommendations for the business
Regular quality monitoring of Installment Loan and Revolving credit products and proposing improvement ideas based on relevant analysis
Closely working with the Data, Engineering, and Risk teams to share data-related roadmaps and help drive data strategy
Develop ad-hoc reports and analyses to support Installment Loan and Revolving credit product needs



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong SQL knowledge - window functions, common table expressions, optimization techniques, clean code, etc
Experience with Power BI or any other BI tools
Experience with Python or R
Willingness to work in a fast-evolving environment
Fluency in spoken and written English
Passion about what you do



BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE:


Previous work experience in the Financial/Fintech sector
Experience with DAX expressions, Power BI Data Flows,Power Query, and Data Modeling
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics
Good MS Excel skills
Knowledge of Data Transformation tools like DBT
Knowledge Data Orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience working with Atlassian (Confluence, Jira)



Benefits


Dynamic, challenging, and rewarding work within a growing international company where one can REALLY make an impact;
Regular company parties and events;
Brand new office in the center of the city with games and free snacks/drinks;
Competitive remuneration package
Sports or health insurance compensation
Birthday day-off


Join us and contribute to our mission while advancing your career. Apply now!


Please note that this is not a remote position and requires to be present at the office at least 3 days a week.

Title: (Junior) BI Consultant
Description:
Job Description

Job summary: Support the BI strategy for our European NIQ clients, enabling them to self-serve using our tools. Scope, build and deliver solutions that meet their basic recurrent data needs. Leverage NIQ and third parties solutions to meet your value delivered target

Qualifications:


1-3 years of experience in client servicing in FMCG sector, especially in Business Intelligence
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluentcy in English
Proven experience in BI tools and data analysis such as Discover (NIQ) or PowerBI, Microstrategy
Previous experience working with: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Passion for learning and applying new technologies to business solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities
Building and maintaining effective work relationships
Good collaboration skills to meet client needs and achieve organizational goals
Ability to work in a remote-based environement


Key responsibilities:


Assist NIQ clients in understanding and utilizing BI tools effectively
Develop and propose BI solutions tailored to clients' recurrent data needs
Deliver on performance tracking and success measurement
Consult directly with clients and stakeholders on how to optimize uses of BI tools, applications for automation, analytics and reporting
Identify leads from client interactions, be able to channel these needs into business opportunities
Own end-to-end processes of in-scope reporting solutions across a variety of data sources (RMS, CPS, Omni)
Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client requirements are met
Work closely with manager and team leaders to assist in day-to-day BI customer support needs, deployment activities and transformation initiatives
Aid in user education for platform-specific instruction to drive usage/adoption of Business Intelligence tools and supporting clients with our performance measurement services.
Share best demonstrated practices in an open, creative and inclusive team culture.
Collaborate with fellow BI and Insights teammates to identify business process improvements, project efficiencies and revenue opportunities.
Be active and engaged in continuous learning opportunities to upskill yourself, our team and advance our core areas of expertise.


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Analista dati
Description:
Azienda & Valori:

Il nostro cliente è una multinazionale leader nel settore oil & gas, con una presenza consolidata a livello globale. La sede italiana, situata in Milano, zona centrale, è il cuore delle operazioni commerciali e amministrative del gruppo per l'Europa. L'azienda promuove un ambiente di lavoro dinamico, innovativo e inclusivo, con un forte focus sulla crescita e lo sviluppo delle competenze dei propri dipendenti.




Titolo della posizione:

Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale (M/F/D)




Finalità del Ruolo:

Il Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale avrà la responsabilità di gestire l’inserimento e la validazione dei dati commerciali e di supportare l’analisi dei dati per il monitoraggio delle performance aziendali. Il candidato sarà il punto di riferimento per la gestione delle informazioni legate ai dati di vendita e ai report commerciali, lavorando a stretto contatto con il team vendite e l’area finance. Sarà cruciale l’abilità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight utili per ottimizzare le strategie commerciali.




Tasks:

• Inserire, validare e aggiornare i dati relativi alle vendite e ai clienti all'interno del sistema gestionale aziendale, garantendo accuratezza e tempestività.

• Utilizzare Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato, con una solida padronanza di tabelle pivot, funzioni avanzate e macro per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati.

• Creare e aggiornare report commerciali periodici, monitorando le performance di vendita, il raggiungimento degli obiettivi e i KPI.

• Collaborare con il team commerciale per l’analisi delle previsioni di vendita e l’andamento dei mercati, supportando la definizione di strategie di miglioramento.

• Identificare anomalie o discrepanze nei dati, proponendo soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza del processo di data entry e di analisi.

• Supportare il team nella gestione di grandi volumi di dati, provenienti da diverse fonti, e nella loro integrazione in report consolidati.

• Partecipare alla creazione di dashboard interattive utilizzando strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI o Tableau, per fornire visualizzazioni intuitive e dinamiche delle informazioni aziendali.

• Fornire insight utili e proposte basate sui dati per ottimizzare le strategie di vendita e migliorare l’efficienza operativa.




Relazioni funzionali:

Interne: Collaborazione diretta con il team vendite, l'area finance e il reparto IT per la gestione dei dati e dei flussi di informazioni.
Esterne: Occasionali interazioni con partner esterni o fornitori di software per l'integrazione di nuove soluzioni di analisi e data entry.




Funzioni Primarie:

• Inserimento, gestione e validazione dei dati commerciali.

• Creazione e aggiornamento di report commerciali e analisi delle performance di vendita.

• Collaborazione con il team vendite per l’ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali.

• Utilizzo avanzato di Excel, con particolare focus su tabelle pivot, macro e funzioni avanzate.

• Utilizzo di strumenti di business intelligence per la creazione di dashboard e visualizzazioni dati.




Formazione e Competenze:

Il candidato ideale possiede una Laurea in Data Analytics, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini. È richiesta una solida esperienza nell’uso di Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato e di strumenti di data analysis. La familiarità con strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti costituisce un plus, così come l’esperienza nella gestione di dati in contesti aziendali complessi.




Hard Skills:

• Competenze avanzate nell'uso di Microsoft Excel (tabelle pivot, macro, funzioni avanzate).

• Capacità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight strategici.

• Esperienza nella creazione di report commerciali e nella gestione dei KPI.

• Conoscenza di strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.

• Competenze nel data entry e nella validazione dei dati.

• Esperienza nell’automazione dei processi di analisi e reporting.




Soft Skills:

• Eccellenti capacità di analisi e problem-solving.

• Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli nella gestione dei dati.

• Ottime capacità di collaborazione e comunicazione con team interni.

• Proattività nel migliorare processi e flussi di lavoro.

• Flessibilità e capacità di adattamento in un ambiente dinamico e in costante evoluzione.




Cosa Offre il nostro Committente:

L'azienda offre un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e un ambiente di lavoro flessibile e innovativo:

• RAL fino a 35.000€: La retribuzione annua lorda massima prevista è di 35.000€, commisurata all’esperienza del candidato.

• Smart Working 2 giorni a settimana: Possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida, garantendo un equilibrio tra vita privata e lavorativa.

• Assicurazione Sanitaria Fondo Est: Copertura sanitaria estesa per il benessere del dipendente.

• Ticket Restaurant: Buoni pasto giornalieri da 9€ per ogni giorno lavorato.

• Accesso al welfare aziendale: Iniziative e programmi di welfare volti a migliorare la qualità della vita lavorativa.

• Formazione Continua: Opportunità di crescita e aggiornamento delle competenze, con accesso a percorsi di formazione e sviluppo professionale.




L'offerta è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, nonché a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

I dati personali saranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (GDPR) e della normativa nazionale vigente in materia di protezione dei dati personali. Il trattamento dei dati avverrà con modalità e strumenti idonei a garantire la riservatezza e la sicurezza degli stessi, secondo le finalità indicate nell’informativa privacy che sarà fornita ai candidati. Inviando il proprio curriculum vitae, il candidato autorizza espressamente il trattamento dei dati ai sensi della suddetta normativa e dichiara di aver preso visione dell’informativa sulla privacy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gupta Media was founded 20 years ago on the idea that advertising could create huge leverage in our client's business. Our early work was focused on the entertainment industry, specifically live events (Boston Calling, among others) and recorded music (Sony Music, Universal Music & Disney are all clients). We have dramatically grown our work with big brands (Amazon, Fender) and sports brands (LA Galaxy, Washington Commanders). We have a global client base with a growing local roster across B2B and B2C brands across campaign, content and branding assignments.




We are on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join our Strategy & Analytics team to assist with reporting, tracking, data analysis, advertising strategy, and visualization needs. In this role, you will work internally to assist paid media analysts with reporting requests as well as externally to provide clients with insights regarding their advertising campaigns.




If you are excited by the opportunity to improve reporting for our clients and our analysts, are able to communicate effectively to understand what tools will help solve a problem, and then work collaboratively to design a solution that’s scalable, accurate and easy-to-use, we want to talk to you.




Who You Are:

You have a true love for data. You have no problem tearing apart a problem and living inside a spreadsheet or data set to find the answer to any question.
You have advanced knowledge of SQL, Excel, and Google Data Studio/Data Visualization tools, and enjoy working with SQL on a day-to-day basis.
Experience with Marketing APIs, BigQuery or other cloud data warehouse tools (AWS, Snowflake, Databricks), ETL tools (such as Rivery, Looker, Supermetrics), and/or Python is a plus.
You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and at least 1 year of experience working with marketing data and/or paid advertising campaigns, preferably in a fast-paced agency environment or team structure.

What You’ll Do:




Reporting:

Maintain customized dashboards in Google Sheets and Excel on a daily/weekly cadence.
Use Advanced Excel, SQL, and Google Data Studio/Visualization Tools to generate pivot tables and other visualizations summarizing thousands of lines of data.
Translate performance media metrics into clear, digestible reports for client advertising campaigns.
Communicate insights effectively through Google Slides or PowerPoint decks.




Strategy:

Learn our clients’ businesses and align media strategy with their business goals.
Analyze advertising trends within a single project and across multiple projects to guide media buying strategy.
Apply your background in paid media and/or digital advertising, including understanding concepts like LTV, ROAS, and Incremental Revenue.
Engage in discussions with clients to build trust and gain stakeholder buy-in on media strategy and results.




At Gupta Media, we work hard every day to be better at all that we do — and that includes fostering a diverse and inclusive community that encourages and respects a broad range of backgrounds, experiences and ideas. Join us and help us find the next great idea.




Gupta Media is an office-first organization.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

At MassMutual, we’re passionate about helping millions of people find financial freedom and this passion has driven our approach to developing meaningful experiences for our customers. The Data Engineering team, part of MassMutual’s Enterprise Technology and Experience organization, is comprised of highly skilled, collaborative, problem solvers who are motivated to create innovative solutions that exceed the changing needs of our customers and move MassMutual – and the industry – forward.

To continue our cutting-edge work, we are hiring an Advanced Data Analyst to join our team.

The Team/Job

Our ideal Data Analyst/Developer - Mastery candidate is proficient in data management and has a strong analytical capability. You’ll use your skills to provide subject matter expertise and complete in-depth data analysis, which contribute to the strategic efforts of the team. You’re also detail-oriented and adaptable. The team culture of working collaboratively, cross-functionally, using new technologies combined with the work/life balance provided by MassMutual are core reasons people enjoy working on the Data Engineering team at MassMutual. The ideal candidate has strong hands-on experience with enterprise data platforms such as Vertica/Teradata, as well as a deep understanding of life insurance operations and analytics.

The Impact/Key Responsibilities


Analyze data related to life insurance operations including policy administration, reinsurance, reserves, and risk to generate actionable insights.
Develop and maintain comprehensive data mapping documents and work closely with data engineering teams to ensure accurate data integration and transformation.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and create reporting solutions aligned to strategic objectives.
Partner with data engineers, architects, and IT to validate datasets, optimize queries, and ensure scalable data pipelines.
Work directly with offshore teams to coordinate analysis, share requirements, and maintain consistent quality and delivery timelines.
Mentor junior analysts by reviewing their work, offering guidance, and promoting professional growth.
Define and implement standards for documentation, analysis, and data governance across the analytics team.
Apply strong data modeling knowledge (star/snowflake schema, normalization, dimensional modeling) to support efficient analysis and reporting.
Help Build dashboards, scorecards, and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, or Strategy to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Ensure data quality and compliance with internal controls and industry regulations.


The Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience
3+ years hands-on experience with Vertica, Teradata or other similar tools for querying, performance optimization, and large-scale data analysis.
3+ years of experience with advanced SQL skills


The Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, or related technical field
8+ years of data analytics experience, including 5+ years within Finance domains.
Proficiency in Python
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Vertica, Teradata).
Familiarity with actuarial processes, reinsurance, or regulatory reporting requirements.
Industry certifications (e.g., LOMA, SOA exams) or data/BI certifications (e.g., Tableau, Microsoft).
Proven ability to write detailed source-to-target mapping documents and collaborate with technical teams on data integration.
Experience working in hybrid onshore-offshore team environments.
Deep understanding of data modeling concepts and experience working with relational and dimensional models.
Strong communication skills with the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
A strong understanding of statistical concepts, probability and accounting standards, financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement), and financial ratios.
Strong understanding of life insurance products and business processes across the policy lifecycle
Investment Principles: Knowledge of different asset classes, investment strategies, and financial markets.
Quantitative Finance: Understanding of financial modeling, risk management, and derivatives.
Regulatory Framework: Awareness of relevant financial regulations and compliance requirements.


MassMutual is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply. Note: Veterans are welcome to apply, regardless of their discharge status.

If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us and share the specifics of the assistance you need.
